data.formatted_address: 10 Trần Hưng Đạo, Sơn Phong, Hội An, Quảng Nam 51306, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Historic Hotel

reviews.text: Great location, staff are truly exceptional. Rooms are spacious. Our room faced the road so it is noisy at night. Other room faced the pool and it was quiet. Choose carefully or just ask. Nothing to do with the hotel but our pool time were generally spoilt by many Chinese guests who don’t have consideration for other guests when swimming and smokers by the pool particularly when there are lots of children around. We can’t choose the other guests who stay but it is a fantastic hotel.

Love our room, friendly staff and a great hotel overall. Good breakfast choices for a vegetarian and the location was the best, the hotel was nice and quiet away from the busy streets, but only a few minutes away by walk from the old town. The only thing I’d change is the temperature of the pool, the water was too warm when it was 35 degrees outside. A cooler pool would have been much more enjoyable. I would stay here again and highly recommend it.

Gorgeous small hotel with old world charm and all the little luxuries you expect. It is set in lovely gardens Ethelwyn a beautiful pool centrally located. It is true that the pool water is too hot but it wasn’t that big a deal. There are lots of sun lounges and a pool side bar.
Rooms are nice, we had a pool view. One minor criticism is there is not much cupboard space to store your clothing.
Staff are lovely and very helpful.
The best things about this place are its central location just a short walk to the old town and the lavish buffet breakfast.
I’m really happy that I booked this place. Highly recommended.

We chose this place because of its location being close to the city but when we arrived wow !! This place is beautiful!! Outdoor pool with lounges which was super nice and cared for . Food court for breakfast indoor and outdoor seating . Lots of food options for breakfast . Lunch and dinner also served .
The rooms were really nice and spacious.
Location is really close with walking distance .
The staff are really nice and helpful .
Cannot wait to come back !!!

We would definitely stay here again. Great location just on the central northern edge of the Old Town. Easy walking distance to everything, from the river to Madam Khan's bahn mi. We had an interconnected room for our teen daughter, which worked really well. The daily breakfast had a good mix of local and western options. Rooms are a good size and simply but nicely furnished. Lovely pool and bar area, and it has its own in-house spa. Highly recommended.

data.formatted_address: 28 Nguyễn Tất Thành, Phường Cẩm Phổ, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Silk Village Hoi An - The Tourist

reviews.text: Nice hotel with 2 large pools, good service, lousy plumbing but at least they were always fast to come fix it.  Never could get my bathroom sink to stop dropping.  Great A/C, so good that I had to turn the vents upwards.  Wonderful breakfast buffet. Lovely garden setting. We stayed in the quadraplex rooms.

We got there about 3:00 PM to learn about silk making.
Ended up paying 100000vnd for a 45-minute tour & 150000vnd for lantern making. It was a great mini tour of the 24-day life span of silk worms (eat mulberry leaves 3 days, sleep 1, repeat), spinning & weaving. The English speaking guide was stunning. Mini tour was far shorter than 45 minutes. Somehow we missed the included mulberry tea and water, too.
Lantern making was engaging; plenty of places in Hoi An teach it for $4-6 usd.
My teens blew their budget in the store on silk fabric & ao dai, etc.
Beautiful grounds & traditional, wood structures. Gorgeous entrance.
Overall a bit overpriced for the shortened mini tour, lantern-making (small & monochromatic for the price) and store merchandise.
But, we went & checked it off our touristy things to-do list.
Please be sure to have the mulberry tea; and ask for more silk fabric options for the lantern making.
I knew nothing about silk so the tour was really interesting! It is quite short but good to give you an overview on how they make silk!

An interesting and informative tour of the silk making process and its history.  It's a beautiful place and there are silk items for purchase. At the end there's a demonstration of how to tell the difference between real silk and man-made imitations.
It was good to see full process. You have to book a tour. Otherwise you may be be disappointed like someone else here. Tour is free for hotel guests.

data.formatted_address: 10 Trần Phú, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hainan Assembly Hall

reviews.text: Actually, I enjoyed this more than the Hokkian assembly hall. It is quiet and traditional. The gatekeeper, who thought us from same origin (yes and no, we are not from Hainan but a place nearby), showed us around with passion. It's apparent that this hall is built and decorated with overflowing nostalgia. It's an impressive and touching place to end our day in Hoi An here.

It’s a beautiful place, but the ticket guy was very inappropriate and groped me. I went at off peak ( 2PM) and it was just me . He offered to take a picture of me and then he wanted a selfie which I agreed to and then he slipped his hand on my breast. And tried again when I moved it away.

Ruined my afternoon

Our visit was on 21st Feb 24, morning time.

In this religious establishment, an elderly individual assumed the role of manager and consistently peddled lucky items, such as "lộc - xu may mắn" (lucky coins), to visitors. The commercialization of this sacred space, compounded by the requirement to purchase tickets for entry and the feeling of being deceived, undermines the reverence for the divine and erodes visitors' respect for the sanctity of the site.

I believe governmental intervention to regulate and restrict profit-driven practices like these is imperative.
One of the smaller but photogenic assembly halls. This would look better at night when it is all lit up, that's if it's open then of course...

- third largest among the halls
- located outside the walking streets
- not commercialized
- worth visiting

data.formatted_address: 51 Trần Hưng Đạo, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Phố cổ Hội An - lối vào chính

reviews.text:
There are kiosks around ancient town that have signs (qr codes) for you to buy tickets but it doesn't seem enforce.

Despite ancient town being closed off to cars, it is not pedestrian friendly especially if you have any mobility issues. The motorbikes are allowed and many tourist ride their bikes. The street pavement is not even.

It has an open air market with lot of shops selling the same thing. Remember to barter, ask for at least 30-40% what they are proposing, if they say no walk away!

Many scams , top ones to look out for:
1. A lady carrying fruit basket ( will extort you for money/ she pretends to offer a photos with her or use her fruit basket)
2. Rickshaw bikes ( they will charge by the min)
3. illegal boat tours ( they will drop you off in the middle of nowhere )

I saw a couple of trash cans along the riverfront.
Hoi an old town
A tourist attractions
Historic old street with many souvenir shops
Nice to arrive

data.formatted_address: 4 Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: The Old House of Phung Hung

reviews.text: It is an old building with furniture and plaques that are over 100 years old. But it's in bad maintenance . And the staff sold all kinds of souvenirs, which made people feel a little disappointed. These ancient buildings and furniture can be better protected.

Avoid.... It is overcrowded and there is almost no furniture left. No information whatsoever. Most of the space is full with stuff to sell to tourists. This is basically a big souvenir shop.
For a better reconstitution of a traditional house and more information head to the Museum of Folklore instead.

My girlfriend and I visited the old house in the past week and we had an extremely bad experience with the workers In the house which would put us off visiting again. On arrival they took our tickets and pointed where to go which seemed fine at the time but as we were leaving we noticed other visitors were receiving tours from the workers which we never received or were told about. We approached and asked if we could have a tour and why we were not told before and the person we dealt with was incredibly rude when answering our questions and was very passive aggressive with her responses. This left a bitter taste and in our opinion should have been handled better by the workers. It felt like they cared about hosting tourists but when it came to others they had little care which felt rather discriminatory.
(See below picture of the worker we dealt with that was rude)

The house itself was interesting but I was quite disappointed at the guides/owners of the house because I experienced blatant racism and rudeness from them because I was south East Asian looking and I noticed other south East Asians were treated the same way as I was in that house.

I got in, they immediately checked my ticket but ignored me soon after even when I was trying to ask about the history house. However, when there were some Caucasian people coming in, they a few of them started guiding them around telling them about the history about the house.

I had to ask them point blank if one has to pay for a guide to talk about the house (which I was happy to pay for) in order to learn about the house. They said no, it’s all free and told me to listen into the people who got in at least 20 min after I did, were then greeted immediately and chauffeured by the guide in French. When I explained to them that I didn’t understand French, the lady rolled her eyes at me and then reluctantly they asked another person to guide me in English then pressured me to buy their embroideries.  There was definitely element of racism there because of my appearance and perhaps they feel I don’t have the same spending power in the house. I felt quite upset by the entire experience if I were treated better I would have bought things to support that family like I have done in the other houses.  I feel like this house didn’t have much to offer and didn’t understand why it was recommended in some guide books I read as I had far better experience in other houses where the guides treated everyone fairly and respectfully and houses were more interesting to explorer.

It is a museum about the export of Vietnamese pottery with exhibitions of digs in wooden cabinets.

The real interest is the building, it shows the layout of a traditional house with the shop, courtyard, accomodation and  cooking quarters. So worth exploring for that reason. Note the detailled carving of the marble slab on which the wooden pillars stand.

data.formatted_address: Nguyễn Hoàng, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hội An Night Market

reviews.text: Very beautifully lit! A lot of light and sound fills the air around here. Besides the market, the other areas connected to it are vibrant and super attractive. Definitely a place to visit when visiting Hoi An! Heritage buildings and super friendly walkways to make an enjoyable sight seeing trip!

Welcome to  Lantern city🏮 Hoi An night market is must be in your itinerary in Vietnam 🇻🇳 trip ,

definitely a highlight to our trip in Vietnam. We had good food in Hoi a city and had wonderful experience.

The lanterns on boats along the river and people crossing the busy narrow bridge definitely contributed to the atmosphere of the market place. Many people to watch as well as things to shop. I am sure everyone will gain different experience out from this beautiful night market. Have fun ! And maybe tell me more.

Busy activity with various stalls and bars and shops with a vast and wide variety of products for the young and faint hearted.  Area is very busy late afternoon into evening as popular lantern boats in the locality. Has a good vibe and atmosphere - a must see area for everyone visiting.

Hoi An night market definitely a highlight to my trip in Vietnam. Yesterday night and tonight both nights had a wonderful experience. The lanterns on boats along the river and people crossing the busy narrow bridge definitely contributed to the atmosphere of the market place. Many people to watch as well as things to shop. I am sure everyone will gain different experience out from this beautiful night market. Have fun ! And maybe tell me more.

It's ok. Too touristy. We went on a weekday and by night, started to get crowed. Tourist prices for food, drinks and souvenirs. 4 to 5 hours of people watching and drinking during late day or evening is worth it. By Grab, it's about 400K from Da Nang to Hoi An. 45 mins or so.

data.formatted_address: Phạm Phán, Thanh Hà, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Thanh Hà Terracotta Park

reviews.text: Really beautiful exhibit with an interesting video on how the pottery village here has had to adapt to the advent of plastic and aluminum. Also had a fun pottery workshop/class where you could make your own bowl to take home. Would recommend as a nice, short trip from Hoi An!

Beautiful place! The museum is housed in one building with four floors plus a top floor in the second building. You can even do a pottery workshop here and, of course, enjoy the sculptures of the famous buildings.

Entry fee to the village is 30,000, with an additional 50,000 for the museum.
Particular museum. Cheap ticket price. Not very crowded. Ask for guidance to better understand the various aspects of the workmanship and history of terracotta.
Beautiful, serene museum. None of the buildings including the cafe are air conditioned, so be prepared to walk round in the heat.

I really enjoyed the garden with a lot of structures and iconic buildings around the world.
If you have time in Hoi An, do it.

data.formatted_address: 39B Hoàng Diệu, Thành Phố Tam Kỳ, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hội An

reviews.text: The historical old town has amazing history and architecture. We didn’t encounter too many tourist, but I can see how it can get crazy here. The architecture and street are well planed, the vendors however are bit selling mix of authentic stuff and lots of China made products. Restaurant and bars are plenty around. Highly recommend to get a knowledgeable tour guide to walk you through. If you just walk by without knowing why this place is so special, it would be a waste of time.
A must visit place when you managed to come to Danang. Besides sight seeing, eating, shopping you can enjoy the art shows as well.
Hoi An is my lovely place in Vietnam. I will comeback again.

Found it bit touristy , but it didn't take away uts charm ..yet to explore it fully , yesterday just made a visit and felt it's vibe .Quite colorful and noisy , people seems to be enjoying every bit of it ...

Hoi An is a cozy old town in which everything is harmonious: low-rise historical buildings and temples in greenery, facades decorated with lanterns that transform the city even more in the evening. We visited many temples, a ceramics museum, and attended a musical performance. And also in a Japanese house where tea ceremonies are held, you can make origami and dress up in a kimono. The Japanese Bridge was closed for reconstruction. We tried rice in a coconut pot at the restaurant at the entrance, as well as noodles with tofu for dinner at the restaurant on the embankment, in a special sauce. These noodles can only be found in Hoi An. In the evening we rented a boat and lowered our lanterns. It was an unforgettable trip. Only positive emotions from touching the history of this place, the opportunity to see the architecture of ancient buildings and temples.

data.formatted_address: V8RF+XC9, Lê Hồng Phong, Cẩm Hà, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Di Tích Cây Thông Một

data.formatted_address: 58 Nguyễn Thái Học, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Diep Dong Nguyen House

reviews.text:
My favourite old house in Hoi An old town. The colour and the design is very unique. It used to be a shop that sold all sort of things from silk to medicine from China. Now there’s a lot of old bowls and cups displayed inside. Worth a visit! Or just standing there and watch the crowd passing by.

What’s better is you don’t need a ticket to enter, FREE, and no pushy salesperson soft selling you souvenirs.
Beautiful old house
Nothing to see really.

Mr. Diep Sung, 5th generation of Diep Dong Nguyen traditional medicine house in Hoian.

He owns his family's long-standing antiques museum in Hoian with the famous saying "Diep Dong Nguyen's family has been collecting antiques for many years, only buying them and never selling them."

Photo: Mr. Sung steamed incense and fed pigeons - photo taken in January 2021.
Old house

data.formatted_address: rẽ trái, Cồn Hến, 200 Nguyễn Tri Phương, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Memories Land

reviews.text:
We arrived at the Hoi An Memory Show about two hours early, which gave us ample time to explore and take beautiful photos around the park. The lush landscapes and traditional architecture provided stunning backdrops for our pictures. While the gift shops have rather high prices, there are a variety of food options available, including delicious Vietnamese cuisine and a Chinese restaurant managed by the theme park itself.

The park typically offers small shows scattered throughout the area before the main event, adding to the lively atmosphere. Unfortunately, these were not available during our visit due to the country’s mourning period for the death of their General Secretary.

The main show, however, was absolutely breathtaking. The stage was enormous, with impressive sets and a large cast of performers. The coordination and choreography were outstanding, making the performance a visual spectacle. It was not only aesthetically pleasing but also culturally enriching. The intricate performances and vivid storytelling provided deep insights into the local culture and history, from ancient traditions to modern influences.

One of the highlights was seeing the show from the vantage point of the grandstand, which offered a panoramic view of the entire stage and allowed us to fully appreciate the scale and grandeur of the performance. The vibrant costumes and elaborate props added to the overall splendor.

I’m very glad I attended the show; it was a truly memorable and enriching experience that I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Hoi An.

This place is dazzling and extraordinarily cozy! You can experience the rich Vietnam tradition in this park, especially the drama inside. The drama containing the largest theatre shows the ups and downs of Hoi An, conveying the enchanting stories aroused in history. The most treasurable things consist in how they express their story with such large theatre but don't lmiss the details to make it vital.

This is a small theme park focussing more on the night show than anything. It opens at around 4 pm and provides you with some small side shows prior to seeing the night show. Some are nice to watch and some are downright boring. There are many souvenir shops and eateries while you wait for the night show which starts at 8 pm.  Majority of the crowd who watches the night show are tour groups who only come to watch the show and nothing else. So its quite quiet until the hordes arrived and you can enjoy some solitude and take some nice pictures. There are some nice photo spots too.  The crowd will start forming around 7 pm at the theatre, however no need to rush with the crowd as the waiting time will kill you. There are sufficient seats and you can still see the whole spectacle by  sitting anywhere  regardless. The show is the money spinner for them judging by the crowd and ticket price. Its one hour long consisting of 5 acts depicting the rise of hoi an and its importance. Nice show with many performers and lights and they discouraged any photo taking during the performance. . While going back, the bridge is beautifully lit with myriad colours. The only drawback is this is the only  entry/ exit point and the small lane leading out to the main road is jam packed with tour buses waiting to pick up the tour groups. Its best if you can pre-arranged some transport home as getting a public transport at this hour is quite difficult. As this will mark the end of your exploration of hoi an, it is still an enjoyable experience.  If you ate coming on your own, i think buying a ticket at the counter located at the bridge which opens at 4 pm is still ok on weekdays but not too sure about weekends though.

The main show was amazing! The theme park was meh. There were no maps and barely any signs. We weren’t exactly sure what it was all about and what each structure or area represented. But the 8pm show was worth the ticket price. No cameras are allowed during the show but so many people disobeyed the rules

I enjoyed it and definitely recommend such!
The show starts at 8PM til 9PM.
There are food stalls outside so you can enjoy them before and after the play.
I recommend buying tickets online with the HIGH or VIP seats to see every angle of the show but, of course, a bit more expensive yet worth it. At that time, the weather was pretty good, so we got to enjoy it. But I heard from the staff that even when it's raining, the show must go on. So, better prepare an umbrella or coat in case the rain pours. It's an open space, and only VIP seats get the roof-covered area.

data.formatted_address: Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hội An

data.formatted_address: Cẩm Thanh, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Village Experience

reviews.text:
Today I went on a village tour with one of the most amazing tour guides I have ever had. Cu was extremely friendly and funny. He was so kind and took us around the village where he lives and his home. He was smiling and sharing his good energy and vibes with all of us. I got to meet his wife and one of his children. They were lovely too😍😍🙏. All the farmers and people who served us were very kind and lovely. The tour included cycling, water buffalo riding, traditional farming, fishing, and riding the boat. We also danced with the farmers on the boat, it was really funny 😂😂 I had SUCH AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE with all of them. We had the chance to cook a rice omelette and then had lunch together. I recommend 100% going with him and doing this tour. It's a unique life experience. You won't regret it😍👌🤩🤩
@Hoi An Village experience

The best tour we had in Vietnam! Mr Cu is a great guide, funny and knowledgeable. It was a fun cooking class! (It’s a great activity even for people who don’t like cooking). One thing we loved about Mr Cu approach was that he hired the locals and people with disabilities. By going on this tour, you can also support the local community!

Mr Cu's Hoi An Village experience was the best thing we have done so far on our trip. It was a lovely tour, cycling through the rice fields and leaning about the crop.
Mr Cu speaks excellent English, is funny, engaging and professional, able to answer all our questions. The lunch was prepared by his family at his families cooking school and it was delicious. The best tofu I have ever had.
I would recommend this tour to anyone. It was such a lovely day.
Thank you Mr Cu and your family :)

I highly recommend the Hoi A village experience, my partner and I had such a great time visiting the market, spinning around on the basket boats, fishing/crabbing and most of all the cooking class. Nhung was very informative and great fun! A lovely family run business.

The village experience cycling tour with Mr Cu was a memorable experience for our family of four. We cycled through small rice fields, listened to some entertaining stories and even rode a buffalo, planted rice and made Vietnamese pancakes for lunch.
The group was small and allowed us to get to know another traveler and just take in the countryside.
The basket boat tour was pleasant but not my favorite part.
It can get quite hot at this time of year so be mindful of this with little ones at the back of your bike. My 10 year old now calls all cemeteries we see, Mr Cu's 1000 star hotel and looks forward to eating new types of Vietnamese food because he had such a positive experience at lunch which was included in the village tour.
A family friendly experience which we organized via email and whatsapp. We also went in the morning at 8.30am because it worked for us but maybe the 1.30pm tour may also be an option as the return journey might be cooler.

data.formatted_address: Tổ 3 thôn Vạn Lăng, Cẩm Thanh, Hội An, Quảng Nam 563800, Vietnam
data.name: Làng Dừa Xanh Coconut Basket Boat Tour

reviews.text: So much fun! The owner is speaking very good English. The boat driver is so kind and generous. They tried the best to keep us entertained and happy. The show is also nice. Lunch menu is plenty for 4 people and we could not finish it. Highly recommended!

This tour was SO great. Owner was super accommodating and nice. We booked just the day before and the company was very helpful in advising on the best time (because of crowds and heat) and getting us set up with car pick up and drop off for early the next morning.

We got lucky with an AMAZING guide on the boat who I think is within the family. Made the whole experience incredibly fun, took as many pictures as we wanted, made sure we were able to cool off with fans and an umbrella, was singing, beaming with a lot of light hearted energy.

Pricing was good compared to others on the river. Quick heads up that if you want to get on one of the other boats to experience the spinning it is separate/extra! About 100K VND. Worth every penny, it was a lot of fun lol. 10/10

Really good experience! The staff at Làng Dừa Xanh were so helpful and friendly from the start😊 the boat tour was so much fun and the boat ‘driver’ was so funny and friendly. We spun around and got a nice tour of the river and water 🥥 🌴😆  a great check off the bucketlist, definitely recommend coming here for the experience ✅😊✨

I hadnt booked a tour but got dropped outside of their office by chance but within minutes with the help of the amazing staff i was in a boat and heading down the river.
The"driver" was friendly and told us little bits of history about the area. At the halfway point he asked if i wanted to go in a spinner boat and that was a great experience. Overall the staff were fantastic and I'll be coming back to do it again with them 😁

I had such a great experience on this tour! All of the staff is extremely friendly! “Mama Poo” was my boat captain, she the best and so kind! She took lots of photos of us during the boat ride and then filmed when we did the boat spinning. We started the tour going down a beautiful river and then saw a local fisherman cast his net, followed by fishing for crabs. It was a great afternoon!

data.formatted_address: Cẩm Thanh, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Unseen Hoi An - Food & Culture Walking Tour With Locals

reviews.text: Highly recommend this tour if you’re visiting Hoi An. We were taken to local places we never would have found on our own. Tried so many amazing local foods. Perfect introduction to the city. Our guide Pinky taught us everything and more about not only the city, but Vietnamese culture and the language. Superb tour guide!

The best tour I did in Vietnam! Right from meeting Pinky who met me at the meeting spot and was very kind and friendly. I took the tour with Pinky and walking around with her was like walking with a friend. I loved all the local factories and artisans we met. Everyone was so kind and generous. The food tour after that was equally good and she adjusted it according to my preferences. Pinky made my day in Vietnam extra special and continued to hang with me in Old Town after our tour was over. If you are in Hoi An, I would highly recommend doing this tour!

Can’t say enough about our wonderful morning Unseen Hoi An tour. We had a great experience. Our guide was so good! Hong (aka Pinky) was informative, engaging and very attentive through out our tour. By the end of the morning we felt we had made a new friend. Our tour started with a bang when Hong introduced us to a local man in his home who making more than 150kg of Cao Lau noodles every day. He is working very hard every single day to keep the business of his family. Then we visited a lovely couple who making organic bean sprouts to sell it in Hoi An markets. They welcomed Hong like a daughter and the experience of meeting these local people set the tone for our great morning. The tour encompasses much more than Hoi An ancient town and local cuisine and by the end of the morning we felt we had truly experienced the life of a local. We highly recommend this tour!!!

Pinky is just a great guide that explains and tells about local and national culture, about the food we get to eat and how it’s made and really brings us to unique places in Hoi An. She is really passionate and funny local guide and really loves to tell us about her people, food and culture. The food we ate just great and we tried things that we maybe normally wouldn’t try because we simply don’t know about it. If you are in Hoi An, this tour is a must do!

We really enjoyed the tour, it was a great combination of learning more about the culture of Vietnam and of the region, and trying delicious food that we would not have found otherwise. We saw the food production process, which is also a unique experience. Pinky is a fantastic tour guide, she is funny, passionate about what she does and she took a great care of our small group. Highly recommend!

I am so in love with this place. It's full of colors, must visit

data.formatted_address: 94 Đ. Bạch Đằng, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An ancient town

reviews.text: Hoi An Ancient Town in Vietnam is a charming and picturesque destination that transports visitors back in time. Known for its well-preserved architecture, narrow streets adorned with lanterns, and vibrant atmosphere, Hoi An offers a delightful blend of history, culture, and natural beauty. Strolling through its ancient streets lined with traditional houses, temples, and communal halls is like stepping into a living museum of Vietnam's rich heritage. The town's serene riverside setting adds to its allure, making it a perfect place to explore on foot or by bicycle. With its cultural diversity, culinary delights, and atmospheric evenings illuminated by lanterns, Hoi An Ancient Town captivates the hearts of travelers from around the world.

A must see place, lots of history here, and ancient buildings add to its charm. Shopping is expensive so bargain hard.
Lantern boat ride was just average as its a short trip.
Your guide will buy paper lanterns for you to release in the river. Off course sunset is the best time to visit. If possible stay a night at this ancient town.

Charming and Historical Hoi An Ancient Village

Hoi An Ancient Village is a gem that transports you back in time. The well-preserved architecture and atmospheric streets are a delight to explore. Walking through the lantern-lit alleyways at night is particularly magical. The blend of Chinese, Japanese, and European influences is evident in the old houses, temples, and bridges.

We enjoyed visiting the Japanese Covered Bridge and several historic houses, each offering a glimpse into Hoi An’s rich cultural heritage. The local market is vibrant and a great place to try delicious Vietnamese street food.

Another highlight was taking a boat ride on the Thu Bon River, which provided a different perspective of the village. The locals are friendly and the overall experience is very welcoming. Don’t miss the chance to have custom-made clothes from one of the many tailor shops; the craftsmanship is excellent.

Hoi An is also a UNESCO World Heritage site, which adds to its appeal. It’s best to visit during the week to avoid the weekend crowds. Overall, Hoi An Ancient Village is a must-visit for anyone interested in history, culture, and stunning scenery.

Feel free to adjust the details or personalize the review based on your experience!

Best place to visit and enjoy ancient town of Hoi An, wonderful fusion of French and Vietnamese culture, night lanterns floating on boat. Very beautiful to experience that. Enjoy walk in town, good cafe, enjoy coffee, food, vibrant lanterns, photography while exploring Hoi An streets.
Most important : Hoi An famous for tailoring. If you want to have any dress for you then must visit good stores there. I got stitch one suit by Peace tailoring shop. In 24 hrs got my stitched suit and perfect size. Choose cloth there and they will stitch. Choose any design you like.
Beautiful night to spend.  Stay one night there if you want to enjoy more. Shop for lanterns just don't forget to bargain.

Beautiful quaint little town strewn with souvenir shops and cafes. Take a slow stroll along the town and enjoy its vibe. I noticed that there are 3 main arteries, one at the top, another in the middle and one along the river. All 3 had different sights and sounds so should probably walk all the 3 roads but i preferred the road along the river. There are attractions along the roads and some require a ticket to enter (which if you have purchased the entrance ticket would have  entitled you to enter 5 attractions at no additional cost.  Despite the heat, its very enjoyable walk and you can always hide in a cafe to cool off. There are no cars allowed but 2 wheelers are allowed, so keep your 👀 peeled. The town is quite small but will take you the whole day as there is much to see. Do enter the market too which is in the middle of town. You will know when you reached the end of the town when you suddenly see cars on the road 😝 have an enjoyable time exploring.

data.formatted_address: V8MR+HX8, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Rice fields

reviews.text: I often visit here to enjoy the sunset. It’s so calm whenever we go to the field and have a 360 degree view of the whole wide sky 🌾🌤 . no camera lens can show but real eyes
Amazing place, very close to the city
Really nice during march time due to the green scenery! Be sure to head there closer to sunset in order to catch some buffalos
The best way to cycle out to the beach - scenic, fun and a nice break from the business of Hoi An. Highly recommend! :)
It's full of random souvenir sellers. Avoid this place nothing to see here. Unless you wanna get annoyed by the sellers.

data.formatted_address: 19 Trần Phú, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Market

reviews.text:
Very very beautiful architecture I love the way these old homes have been preserved it's nice to see them inside with the thick Old Timber construction.
Has a very Colonial feel with beautiful balconies.
Would love to live in one.
Hoi An old town is extremely attractive

It’s a decent market, pretty at night. There’s a lot going on. Many different stands. In my opinion I’m a bit disappointed with the prices of the food. I think it’s overpriced for the actual quality. I thought the street food here was definitely a let down. The souvenirs however are brilliant. There’s some really unique and boutique places. Definitely a great place for a unique gift or some memories to take home.
Mostly Korean shop there. Fake Branded stuffs. Can bargained. Lots of shops. Price are on the high end. Not really a place for me to buy things. Look look see see is interesting.

The most expensive market in Hoi An. I don’t recommend it, the flow of tourists is huge, the prices in the market area just skyrocketed many times, people visit neighboring places and the price of food is cheaper. But there are beautiful places and boats nearby

Busy shopping market with plenty of vendors. Food stalls, restaurants, cafes, and desserts everywhere you turn. No shortage of entertainment. Bring plenty of cash, a portable fan, huge appetites, and a camera. It's beautiful.

data.formatted_address: 197 Nguyễn Duy Hiệu, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam 008454, Vietnam
data.name: Phổ cổ Hội An

reviews.text:
I’ve been here near Hoi An for a week. I really love this place. I visit Hoi An both during the day and night. The town gives two different vibes which I enjoy it so much.
There’s much to do and see here. You guys should go to Cộng Cà Phê and try coconut coffee, grab a bánh mì at Bánh Mì Phượng, or visit many art galleries scattered around the town.
During the night, I love strolling along the river, watching little boats sailing back and forth under the colorful lights of lanterns. I’m going to miss this town!

I went in the evening and it was quite crowded. In addition to the stalls displaying unique and eye-catching handicraft products, the food was also very delicious, just a bit hot. Very suitable for a picnic to change the atmosphere.

Omg it’s super beautiful at night , we went after lunar new year so it’s super busy, a few thousand people, a thousand foods on the street, special u can rent a small boat n flower garlands and coloured lanterns, I really feel in love with it, love the streets foods n people here, I will be back

A very beautiful old town to visit, I brought my family here, cycling on the romantic old town, lanterns, bougainvillea flowers are very beautiful.
You should come here in the afternoon and evening
Such an interesting place. Best cultural spot in Vietnam. I like the Mót & Cao Lau food a lot. 👍🏻 recommend to everyone

data.formatted_address: 11, Đường Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Phố Đi Bộ Hội An

reviews.text: Excellent street food and great ambience and decor. Would come back again. You can also watch the food being prepared and cooked. I loved the fresh coconut drink.

The old town is nice with lots of latterns and shops/food options but it is very touristy to say the least. It's worth visiting for a couple of days. Lots of temples and mini pagodas as the old port city of Hoi An was significant to both the Champa Empire and Vietnamese when they conquered the region in the 1800s. Overall though i think its a bit over-rated

Laiyuan Bridge, also known as the Japanese Bridge, was built by the Japanese in 1953 and connected the Chinatown and Japan Town at that time.  It is said that it was built in the year of the monkey and completed in the year of the dog, so there are a stone monkey and a stone dog guarding the entrances on both sides of the bridge.  A small temple dedicated to Xuantian God was built in the bridge to bless the local residents to go in and out safely.

The beauty of Hoi An Ancient Town is more stunning and pristine than Hanoi Old Quarter, but there is one thing in common is that they are both a miniature city - some corners are dynamic and bustling and other corners are quiet and tranquil.
2 star cos the famous bridge is under renovation. Very crowded. Many food stall, drink stalls, gift stall all these.... everywhere & stalls selling much the same things (keep repeating)

data.formatted_address: Old Town, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Phố cổ Hội An

reviews.text: In the old town, it must be said that it is super beautiful. Tran Phu street is not ashamed to be the most beautiful street in the world in Hoi An

Enjoyed white rose dumplings and a family atmosphere at this cafe near the river. The owner Chris told us a story about his mother who is in an old photo on one of the walls. She is carrying her grandson on one side and vegetables on the other side using a carrier pole.

He told us she still gets up at 4am daily to pick vegetables and bicycles to the market to sell these in exchange for meat and other products for her family, prepares meals, works in the garden, and looks after grandchildren. She is 74 years old and doesn’t want to stop working. .

This was a lovely insight into their family life, and the dumplings were really tasty too.

Lovely must-visit destination. I must have visited this place more than 20 times, the charm of this little town captivated everytime. However, things are getting incredibly expensive there. It's unbelievable.
It's like going back in time, and life is slow here. My favorite place to spend a few nights once in a while just to reset myself
Beutiful ancient town located not too far from yellow sandy beach of Quang Nam province. A world heritage site you must visit once in you life.

data.formatted_address: W87R+C7R, Đ. Hai Bà Trưng, Tp. Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: An Bang Beach

reviews.text:
Nice Beach with a long stretch of brown sand around. I reached there at 5 AM in the morning and to my surprise there were a lot of locals already taking a dip in the sea. It seemed like daily practice for them to take a bath in the rising sun and do some exercises to start the day with.

It was a very calming experience and great insight into the local living style in that region.

Tip: If you are taking a grab bike ride to the beach, make sure you arrange the way back as well, I was not able to find any Grab at 7:30 AM from the beach to Hoi An, and I had to take a lift.

Great, long stretched beach with few people. Nice place to relax, swim and surf when waves are ok. Sun beds are included when buying a meal or coffee. Beautiful mornings with lots of activity both by locals and visitors!

An Bang Beach is an ideal destination for those who love vibrant and lively atmospheres.
Its fine white sand and crystal-clear waters attract many visitors seeking relaxation and enjoyment by the sea. The bustling crowds create an energetic ambiance, complemented by the large waves that make the beach experience exciting and exhilarating.

It truly is a must-visit destination for those looking to explore and appreciate the natural beauty of the ocean.

The beach was a lovely white sand beach and you could rent a lounger for 50,000 dong for the entire day!

There’s plenty of nice restaurants a short walk away too and nice spots to go to have a refreshing drink or a cocktail.

Sad that we couldn’t stay until the sunset but the skyline later on in the day was amazing and really a must see!

Lovely long beach with plenty of options to find a sun lounger for the day. Some loungers are free if you order a drink or food, others further up the beach are 100,000 VND.  Good swimming  with gentle waves. The sand gets very hot!

Beautiful river.  Amazing place.
Crowded but still relaxing to walk around.
The old town is bigger than expected.  Good to visit around by a 15min bike trip. 👍🏽
Vibrant and colorful establishments on both sides. Charming bridges. Good place to soak in the culture of Hoi An

This beautiful location made somewhat underwhelming by a river of tourists posing for selfies and pushy hawkers trying to sell you "happy hour" boat rides. This made for a crowded, chaotic, loud experience. Otherwise quite a beautiful location. The dusk is not as loud or crowded.

Hoi An is a unique and charming destination that offers a blend of history, culture, and modern amenities. Whether you're interested in exploring ancient architecture, trying local cuisine, or simply relaxing on the beach, Hoi An has something to offer everyone. Visitors can also explore the local markets and shops, which offer a variety of souvenirs and local products, including textiles, ceramics, and traditional lanterns. There are also several temples and historical sites to visit, including the Quan Cong Temple and the Old House of Tan Ky.
Very nice place in Hoi An the old town.

data.formatted_address: 77 Trần Phú, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Nhà cổ Quân Thắng

reviews.text: Beautiful ancient architecture and a really nice family welcoming you inside. Recommended to visit with a guided tour to know everything about it. Inside you will also find a little restaurant to enjoy some delicious traditional dishes.
Short 15 min abt the history of this building and its floods. Not as thorough as those old Nyonya houses you see in Penang and Malacca but a nice look through the back office of a medicine shop

Was the building admission process not properly explained to you when you bought your ticket? (And not properly explained on the provided map either)? Do you then enjoy being screamed at in a foreign language something you couldn’t possibly have known when you try to enter? Then this place is for you!

Five stars because I’m sure it truly is a lovely place….

This a beautiful old house that you must visit while walking around Hoi An. Its not only a that though.. the family that lived here for many years does some Hoi An specialities such as White rose dumplings, Cao Lau, com ga and fried wantons. Its amazing to see them making the dumplings al together as a family, it was delicious and great to have some food seating in such a beautiful location.

Great White roses!
Come and try them here. Done by hand over generations. Such a good place to visit and have a snack or lunch

data.formatted_address: Trần Nhân Tông, Cẩm Thanh, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hạnh Coconut

reviews.text: We went to a wrong place but this operator is so well known and other people contacted them to pick us up, they handled it in the most friendly way and my kids got to have this excited motorbike ride as bonus. I was a bit scared but they got super excited. The boat ride was way more interesting than we thought, the ‘driver’ was extremely friendly and let my kids to catch some crab. The whole experience was so entertaining and well worth the price. Highly recommend!

An amazing attraction. We arrived in a taxi at the beginning of the street and said we needed to get to "Hanh coconut". There was a guy who took us to the right place. We got on the boat and it was steered by a very nice woman. She realized that we don't like the hustle and bustle further down the river, so she took us aside a bit. There are 2 central places on the river where many boats stop and people sing karaoke and there is a lot of noise. Besides, it is quiet and very pleasant to sail quietly. A very good experience and I highly recommend it! Thank you.

Amazing place filled with a lot of tourists and a lot of vendors trying to sell you a coconut boat ride.

It's a great experience and one should definitely try this out. Approx 13-15 km from the central Hoi An, you can reach here by grab bike and negotiate with the vendors to book a 45-50 min coconut ride. It should ideally price you around 80-100K, if they are charging more, you're fooled.

By the way, the ride is a good experience, they have different experiences such as ride boat dance, karaoke where you can tip the guys according to your will.

During peak time, you might need to wait up to 30 mins for your boat even if you have booked an advance ticket.

It can be very hot in the middle of the day.  So do bring an umbrella.

Your boatman will persuade you to tip the performer. If you are unwillingly, you can choose not to.

Overall, I would say it is good to try at least once in your life.

Immersing yourself with traditional Vietnamese coconut boat was definitely a worth it experience.
Friendly local rode the boat with fun and friendliness.
The river surrounding was beautiful and every moment of the ride was definitely worth for a picture.

data.formatted_address: 104 Thái Phiên, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Ancient House

reviews.text: Nice experience, but not a must if you are in Hoi an. The couple is very polite to show you around the house they live and also explain how they used to live also their ancestors. Of course the setting is made in such a way that at the end they try to sell you something, but in a very nice and polite way. We kindly refused to buy anything and instead donated some money in a box that they have.
Interesting visit into an ancient home of five generations. A little underwhelming and hot visit as it was quite small. The best part it is free.
Well preserved from many centuries ago. Paid or ticketed entry.  It’s a unesco site so it’s really beautiful and authentic.  No Disney shows here.  Only the weather is super hot and humid.

YOU GOTTA GO! The family has lived there EIGHT GENERATIONS! And the owner/host is one of the most joyous people EVER! He ALSO works as a silver smith and he was SO endearing I bought my FIRST piece of jewelry ever. Free entrance.
Very warm welcome by the owner, we enjoyed the little Tour a lot.

data.formatted_address: 100 Nguyễn Phúc Tần, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Lantern Making Class

reviews.text: A wonderful experience that our whole family enjoyed (2 adults, 3 teenagers). The welcome was friendly and a lot of care was taken to instruct us how to make the lanterns. Small place, we were the only ones there. You can fold them to bring home in your luggage. They make a beautiful souvenir, very representative of lovely Hoi An with all its lanterns. Highly recommended!

Found this place on google maps, message her and got booked in for the next day! Phi was very nice lady and spoke very good English. I really enjoyed making the lanterns it was fun and I loved that it was only me and my boyfriend there,  can't wait to hang them up when we get home, thank you so much for today!!

Just when you didn’t think Hoi An could be any more beautiful our Homestay host booked us into Phi’s evening class. This was solo and intimate with Phi which made for a really sweet setting. Phi is funny, patient (even with my heavy hands) and is so experienced in lantern making. There’s no better keepsake than learning traditional Vietnamese craft. So many fabrics to choose from we enjoyed ourselves so much and the lanterns stayed safe even with 10 days left of travelling north Vietnam. Thank you for your kindness Phi, our special lanterns look so cute in our home :) a class we will never forget!

A really nice lantern workshop near Hoi An Town, the owner was helpful, her instructions were easy to understand as well. They even offered drinks when we arrived. Overall it’s an amazing experience which you can consider when visiting Hoi An.
Phi is a great teacher, what's a really nice person with a big smile ready to help. Very relaxed atmosphere and great value. She gave us water and an extra lantern with our class. Highly recommend ❤️

data.formatted_address: 7 Nguyễn Huệ, Sơn Phong, Hội An, Quảng Nam 563890, Vietnam
data.name: Rehahn Gallery

reviews.text:
Hoi An, Vietnam, is home to a vibrant art scene that beautifully encapsulates the cultural richness and diversity of the country. Among the standout contributions to this scene are the galleries and institutions founded by the renowned French photographer, Réhahn. These establishments not only serve as a testament to his passion for Vietnam's landscapes, lifestyles, and diverse cultures but also act as cultural bridges connecting visitors from around the world to the intricate beauty of Vietnamese heritage.

### The Precious Heritage Art Gallery and Museum
- **Location**: 26 Phan Bội Châu street, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Việt Nam.
- **Contact**: +84 94 982 06 98
- **Opening Hours**: Open daily from 8am to 8pm.
- **Features**: A historic 19th-century house that showcases large scale portraits, stories, and traditional tribal costumes of Vietnam’s 54+ ethnic cultures. It's a profound cultural museum and gallery celebrating the rich diversity of the country. Admission is free.

### Réhahn Art Gallery
- **Location**: 7 Nguyễn Huệ street, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Việt Nam.
- **Contact**: +84 94 982 06 98
- **Opening Hours**: Open daily from 10am to 6pm.
- **Features**: Réhahn’s first official gallery in Hoi An's Ancient Town, offering a moment of tranquility with a picturesque view of the vibrant colors on Hoi An’s buildings and silk lanterns. It presents his well-known portraits, landscapes, and lifestyle photographs, available in various formats including the exclusive Limited Edition series.

### Réhahn’s Private Studio
- **Location**: Located in a Zen corner of Hoi Seam Ancient Town on Truong Minh Luong.
- **Appointment**: Only open by reservation.
- **Features**: Housing some of the artist’s favorite photos from Vietnam, Cuba, and India, including part of his private collection. This gallery focuses on Réhahn’s bestselling Collector’s Original Limited Editions on ultra-premium metallic paper.

### Exhibits & Offerings
Across these establishments, visitors can explore a variety of exhibitions and artworks:
- **The Hidden Smile of Madam Xong**: One of Réhahn’s most iconic photographs.
- **Fine Art Photography Books**: Including the “Vietnam, Mosaic of Contrasts” trilogy and “100 Iconic Portraits”.
- **Artisanal Workshops**: Occasional workshops with members of the ethnic tribes, along with discussions, book signings, and other events.

### Why Visit
- **Cultural Immersion**: These galleries and museum offer invaluable insights into Vietnam’s multifaceted cultural landscape, celebrating its beauty, diversity, and the stories of its people.
- **Unique Art**: A chance to view and purchase unique fine art photographs, books, and limited-edition art pieces that capture the essence of Vietnam and other countries through Réhahn’s lens.
- **Meet the Artist**: Visitors might get the rare opportunity to meet Réhahn in person, especially at his private studio, and hear first-hand stories of his travels and artistic journey.

Réhahn’s contributions have significantly enriched Hoi An’s cultural and artistic landscape, making his galleries and museum must-visit destinations for art enthusiasts, photographers, and cultural explorers seeking to delve deeper into the heart and soul of Vietnam.

I love photography, and I know Rehahn's photography work from social media. I know he is very popular and has amazing art with his skills.

But sadly, today when I came to this 'free exhibition,' I was shocked by the staff woman. She suddenly yelled at me, 'Excuse me, you just came without permission,'. I don't completely remember how she said it, but she was mean.

I hadn't realized she had just finished talking with someone when I arrived at the entrance. Instead of using those words, for some visitors... it would probably be good if she had just said 'hello, is there anything I can help you with or others...' with nice words.

I was shocked for a few minutes. But then at the end, she still smiled when I told her that I didn’t mean to just go without asking for permission, but I knew she was talking with someone when I arrived, so I was waiting my turn.

She still gave us some other recommendations for parts of the museum, which are in other areas not far away, and we also went there because we love photography, art, travel, and human interest.

A good place to visit, I know this is a free place , no entrance free and I’m coming here not just for take a random picture or selfie, of course I want to enjoy the art and learn something from the picture.

but I just wanted to share my experiences today and want to give some ideas about how to treat visitors.

Nice little place with free entrance. The lady gave us some good info on what's what! If u pass by, definitely pop in for some brilliant pictures! If you have more time, I recommend to skip this and go straight to the Precious Heritage Art Gallery Museum. Same company, also free, and everything from the little gallery is also on display there!

Really lovely museum and the photographs are incredible. Ngoc was great and really went above and beyond for us, offering to get the picture I bought signed and delivered to my hostel that same night for no extra charge. I can not wait to hang the picture up at home. They also gave out mini postcards to each visitor.

What else I can say? I was so touched by this place.. the vibe, the music, the pictures, the costumes,… but the most important - how much Réhahn contributes to Vietnam’s culture.

Definitely recommend 1 hr+ for this gem of Hội An. 🇻🇳

data.formatted_address: V8VM+WFX, Đ. Hai Bà Trưng, Cẩm Sơn, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Rice Fields-Cycling&Sunset

reviews.text:
If you’re staying in Hoi An, definitely don’t miss this peaceful experience of cycling through the rice fields. Our hotel let us borrow their bikes for free so we cycled to this pin and once we got there, just cycled all around the fields. It is so peaceful and beautiful, a great way to get a break from the crowds of the old town. Photos won’t do this place justice on just how peaceful it was.

We went there at around 12PM and it wasn’t that busy - you could definitely spend hours here cycling around as there is so much land to cycle across. Just be careful on the way there if you’re driving on the main road (we ended up going back to our hotel through the back streets).

My hotel was really near so i went by walk and it was really great experience. Because i was walking some locals had time to greet me and were very happy and waves at me from the field. You can see how they work hard and it's beautiful to see that.
Some of the fields were being harvested. It is really hot during the day here. Bring water and something to cover up with. No tickets are needed.

Beautiful rice paddy
I rented a bicycle from my hotel and cycled from old town to the rice paddy. The traffic was chaotic but people do give way so it was a fun experience riding on Vietnam’s streets.
The rice paddy was beautiful. The rice was about to be harvest and the fields were green and yellow in colour.
However it can be hot in Hoi An, about 35 degree Celsius in Apr and even hotter from May-Aug. Recommend to bring a cap, water, and wear sunscreen and long sleeves to prevent sunburn
Good place for sunset and sunrise. Plus admiring the rice fields is great. What many people think of when they listen about Vietnam.

Tour is so great. Thanks for your services.
I bought tour ticket from KKday for this tour. Very nice trip and we enjoy the arrangement for the tour. We are really appreciated ppl to come and joint this tour.

This ticket grants admission to five different attractions. One of the staff members, who spoke English, guided us through parts of the museum and ensured we saw all the exhibits. Although it's a small museum, we think it could benefit from expanding its collection to include more artifacts and historical items.
Closed but still beautiful building to look at - they let you in & if not next to park you can gain entrance from.. Old French colonial building I'm guessing still beautiful as decays.
You can learn the brief history of Hoi An, which is interesting.   You need to have the  entrance fee ticket for the Old Hoi An city area, and it is worth purchasing.
A very disappointing museum most of the smaller museums have better content than this one. Not worth visiting
Some rooms are similar to museum of ceramic

Very interesting. A bit outdated. Good to use one of your tickets
A MUST for any archaeologist or anyone with an interest in archaeology in Hoi An! Such a beautiful space, I can’t recommend it enough.
Some interesting history to read about and the old home is nice to visit. But the ceramic pieces aren't that fascinating unless you're really into this specific art history or ceramic arts.
Interesting place, looking at the history of ceramic trade, not many pieces but it’s still not too bad. Watch out for the steps going up/down though. It’s sus

data.formatted_address: 33 Nguyễn Thái Học, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Museum of Folk Culture

reviews.text:
The exhibits and descriptions need a refresh, but it’s still worth a visit as it is the most comprehensive museum in Hoi An. You can also try some local tea.

You can take a calligraphy class here and don’t need to buy a second ticket to enter the museum for it.
Small, but with interesting displays. They were quite interested in selling us silk scarves after giving the talk about how the silk was produced.

Worth spending one of your five tickets to visit, but otherwise nothing out of the ordinary. Gives a good picture of the traditional and customary industries within Hoj An. I think it would be great if the exhibits were designed with some storyline in mind, as the relics and exhibits feel slightly disjointed/unrelated. A good primer to start your trip in the old town if you want to have an idea of what life is like for the Viet people in Hoi An.

Decent little stop with exhibits on Hoi An’s traditional crafts and industries, such as tailoring, as well as local art for sale. It’s included in the multi-pass ticket you can pick up a few blocks away to the north, along with several other museums and cultural sites in Hoi An.

Museum is small, but interesting, with information in English. There you can learn how the silk is made and they also explain how to recognize a fake silk, also you can buy silk scarf, the simplest one for 20$ and you know it’s real silk. You can also buy a small bag of Lotus tea (i guess around 50g) for 2$ and lucky zodiac coin for 20k dong.

data.formatted_address: 26 Đường Phan Bội Châu, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: Precious Heritage Art Gallery Museum

reviews.text:
What a stunning place! I deeply regret not going sooner and for longer! I went with my friend (back in March) on our last day and an hour before closing - definitely not enough time!!
Such rich history and culture all captured so beautifully!
It’s a true labour of love and admiration for the 54 different ethnicities. So so important.
I highly recommend it! And free too!
Thank you Rehann for your dedication, passion and perseverance.

Loved my visit to this place. The work by photographer, Rehahn captures the individual heritage of each ethnic group in Vietnam, their costumes, music and trade. You can see he is highly respected by the groups in the videos where he is warmly welcomed into the family life.  Don’t miss it if you want a peek into the extraordinary diversity of Vietnam’s ethnic people. And it’s free!!
A beautiful private art gallery with a free entrance. All collections of traditional clothes from minority groups in Vietnam are amazing! A must visit place for travellers 👍

A very good place to understand all the minor ethnics in Vietnam and their traditional clothing, all documented by a photographer. The entrance is free, you can park your bicycle outside and visit it. They also sell portraits and postcards for the photos taken by the photographer. You can also sit, read and watch the documentary in the museum. Highly recommend to visit if you are interested to their history !

Vivid and vibrant arts gallery offering a rare glimpse into hyper-local ethnic groups in Vietnam. It opens your eyes to an unseen side of Vietnam, and it's totally free! Time well-spent. Have a look if you're in Hoi An.

data.formatted_address: 34 Nguyễn Thái Học, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Museum of Traditional Medicine

reviews.text: Worth it if you’ve already been to the temples and communal houses. The displays and explanations desperately need a refresh.

Beautiful house, mostly empty of any significant objects, pictures or information about traditional medicine. Mostly empty spaces. The information provided is basic and little. The only employee is there watching YouTube. Don’t use the tickets here, not worth it.

This anchient two floors building provides information about traditional medicine in Vietnam, including kind of plants, tools to make the medicine, and the traditional medicine process. It was free to enter this building. But you have to wear mask for covid safety reason.
Charming building, inside and out but there is barely anything exhibited. 10minute visit at the most,
Nice little exhibition, but the best part was to have the house for ourselves so we enjoyed the building without the crowds found in the turistic ones.

data.formatted_address: 229 Cửa Đại, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: CSO Gallery Hoi An

reviews.text: This is a very well-presented gallery. I went there to get an old coin I had recently found dated and ended up staying for more than two hours (I talk a lot and ask a lot of questions) admiring the displays of famous Vietnamese literature, along with coins, banknotes and stamps from Vietnam and around the world. Ms Phuong (my guide) shared her knowledge and inspired me to look further into the history of Vietnamese literature and its dynasties. The owner is very passionate and knowledgeable about his collection. He was also able to give me a confirmation of the era of my coin. Overall, it was a wonderful experience.
What an amazing collection of history, literature, coins and bank notes. Beautifully curated and well worth a visit.

Totally recommend checking out this exhibition! It's like a trip through time, with awesome stamps, ancient coins, and vintage books that'll blow your mind. Seriously, each piece has its own story, and it's like you're living history. Plus, it's super cool to see how everything's preserved.
A must-visit destination in Hoi An. It is an incredible experience and I was so impressive with the huge coin and stamp collections from different time periods and cultures.

I have to congratulate your team on the beautiful layout and design of the new area. The whole experience of viewing art is greatly enhanced by the mood generated by the distinctive blend of lighting, architecture, and general aesthetics. A great deal of care and consideration went into designing a space that enhances the artwork on show. The diversity of artists and art forms showcased is both impressive and refreshing. I appreciated the variety of styles and themes, providing visitors with a well-rounded perspective on contemporary art. Reading the in-depth descriptions that accompanied each piece taught me more about the setting and objectives of the artists. The story of Kieu, which is Nguyen Du's most remarkable and dedicated work, has been expertly exhibited at the exhibition. It's evident that your staff values providing information and engaging with visitors, and their commitment to enhancing the watching experience is commendable.
I am grateful for providing our community with such a wonderful cultural space. Your dedication to showcasing diverse art forms and creating an enriching environment has undoubtedly made a significant impact. I look forward to future visits and witnessing the continued success and growth of the CSO gallery.

data.formatted_address: V8GF+HMQ, An Hội, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Sông Hoài Phố Cổ Hội An

reviews.text: Tealight floating on boat is the best activity in Hoian . You can also try to work as a friendly vendor.
Big crowd and lots of shops
Good

On the 14th and 15th of the lunar calendar each month, there is a flower lantern release ceremony. The ticket price to get off the boat depends on the time you choose. You should choose a boat right at An Hoi bridge and a rowing boat, do not choose a ticket to go by motorboat because you cannot get inside An Hoi bridge. And definitely anyone offering to buy boat tickets should ask in advance if they can get inside An Hoi bridge and row by hand or not. Because there are many people who buy by mistake and will lose their experience when coming here.

The old town area of ​​Hoi An next to the river is very cool. To walk or enter any of the abundant cafes and restaurants in the area. It is advisable to go in the low season (if something like that exists in Hoi An), so as not to be buried by hordes of tourists ;)

data.formatted_address: 24 Trần Phú, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Quan Cong Temple

reviews.text: This is a temple dedicated to the great chinese warrior, quan yu well known for his warrior skills and loyalty. He is often found in many homes as a deity to worship. Its a very calming place here away from the crowds. At the back is a lady Buddha statue or guan yin, a deity with the kindest of heart. Plenty of things to see and scrutinise here.

One beautiful temple you can stop by in Hoi An. You can get a ticket for 120kVND and visit 5 sites out of a selection of 22 in the area. It's worth it and gives you a purpose for walking around and it helps maintaining the historical sites.

This is quite a good temple to visit in hoi an ancient village.

Bery good location.

And there is a enterance fee sometimes...,

You have to buy a ticket before you get in the hoi an ancient village.
One of my favorite temples in Hoi An.

Its quite darkinside. The place is in a deteriorating state. Maybe too many visitors. You can keep your shoes on. In the back is a bigger room with impressive wooden doors. Big marble table.
Huge Statue in front but hidden behind glass.

data.formatted_address: 60 Đ. Bạch Đằng, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Home Taste

reviews.text:
Captain Chris has more to offer than just a great restaurant and incredible river front location. He also has an amazing rate for his sunset boat cruise, ice cold beer ON TAP and chill tunes that make a relaxing atmosphere right in the middle of Hoi An bustle.
More than all of this though, Chris himself is an amazing host. Relaxed and accommodating he offers great advice and guilty travellers. We made Home Taste our Home Base, calling in for a beer, to use the toilets or just to get directions whenever we needed. All “no worries” according to Chris.
Can’t wait to call in next time I am in town.

A great lunch at a great place in a great town. Great coffee salted or egg. Omg i love that coffee. Big cold beers if like beer. Very enjoyable food. The Avocado and Tomato with egg on toast except was not smashed was indeed smashing. Great outlook as well and friendly staff. Will go again.

Home Taste is the best restaurant in Hoi An. Chris, the owner and chef, trained in Hanoi before opening his own restaurant. The food is excellent and cheap. The situation is perfect next to the river. He also does excellent boat tours every afternoon where you get a good excursion and food without being ripped off! A wholehearted recommendation.

Captain Chris is a legend! Spent a fantastic afternoon on the river with ice cold beers included, an exciting and fun basket boat experience and a spectacular sunset… all for 300,000 VND (about a tenner) definitely recommend

What a lovely place, right on the riverside. We stopped in for an egg coffee and stayed for a beer too, lucky enough to meet the charming Chris who is super friendly and knowledgeable. Like almost everyone we've met in Vietnam so far Chris is kind and friendly. The cafe is beautiful, you can watch your food being prepared and the outdoor seating lets you soak in the site's  and sounds of Hoi An - a must visit

data.formatted_address: 136 Nguyễn Thái Học, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam 51000, Vietnam
data.name: 소원배 타는 곳

reviews.text:
Not many tourists during the day time,  but gets very busy during the night. Try there local foods and enjoy the culture.
Too many people offering boat rides 🙄

really enjoyed this, did this for my birthday. costs 150,000 for up to 3 people so worth the money. the lantern cost us 10,000 each, we told her to wait one moment whilst we bought the tickets and then her pal came over and tried to make her charge us 50,000 each, don’t pay for anything over 10,000 just walk away from them.
the shopping near this is very nice..  the night look of this village is really very interesting and beautiful.. i suggest must visit during night to view real beauty of this village..

Here in early July 2023
What a busy touristy spot during evening time as people some here for their boat ride, sightseeing and strolling around the night market.

A lot of lanterns shining at night and it was stunning and also still busy. You can pick your own seat along the river to enjoy the view of this lantern town. Great to memorize it 🇻🇳🛶🏮
A boat tour that costs about 150,000 to 200,000 Vietnamese Dong. It lasts about 20 minutes. The scenery is nothing special, but it's worth enjoying lightly.

data.formatted_address: Chàm Islands, Cham Islands, Tân Hiệp, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Chàm Islands

reviews.text:
Beautiful island with clear waters to swim in. Gets crowded quickly.
Restaurant serves basic food, comes included in the snorkel or scuba dive price, but keep in mind drinks costs extra.

It’s so fun, we ride a super canoe went to the island, they introduced some island’s history, then u can drink fresh coconut water here, n they rides us to snorkeling w hot weather, so it’s perfect time for us, after that we had lunch time, sea food was awesome, fresh n fantastic taste, the tours included lunch but w seafood u must pay extra if u want it. After everything u can bought a võng n lay down on the sand w fresh orange juice b4 come back to land. We’re really enjoyed

Pros: decent for a day trip to see something different from Da Nang and snorkel.

Cons: tour groups feel like a scam with too many stops. From pick up to drop off was ~ 8 hrs. My primary intention was snorkeling and did only one hr of it.
Corals - if snorkeling there is very little to see and not colorful..

A beautiful island near Hoi An City of Vietnam.

Has a very interesting history of its origin and rule over the years.

One can try water sport activities like Scuba Diving & Snorkeling here with their friends and family.

To reach to the island, a speed boat is used which is covered from roof. One can get mesmerizing views of sea from the window.

At the beach they provide you with sea food both veg & non-veg as per your comfort level.

480k/pax for a tour including snorkelling, lunch, motorboat from/to the island.
800k more for scuba diving (about 20 minutes). 200k more if u want them to take photos for you.
People r nice. Worth trying. Came here in end of March. Weather was wonderful. Must try grilled sea urchin and grilled squid on the island sold by locals.
The diving price here seems to be the cheapest among the islands allowing diving in Vietnam.

data.formatted_address: Bình Minh, Thăng Bình District, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Vinpearl River Safari

reviews.text:
Must visit specially with your kids. They will enjoy boat safari for 35 minutes. They will feed the giraffe and the elephant. No crowds in weekdays. You will walk in the park and enjoy.
The employees have good attitude and animals here are well taken care 💖
Smaller than vinwonder Phu quoc, still enough for 1 day visit. The safari is small, travel by boat in 25 mins only. Water park is the highlight, relax between 4-6pm.

Wife and I had a great day here.Both in our 60's so didn't need to use watermark lol.Very entertaining to watch and learn about the Vietnamese way of life and the live shows were great.
The water and light show at the end of the day was the icing on a delicious cake.Was worth the admission price alone.
Plenty of things for all ages to see and do here and the staff are brilliant and very assisting.
Huge thumbs up from us.

The safari trip was enjoyable. Upon arrival, there was a long wait for the boat, about 40 minutes. This might have been because it was the weekend, as the other part of VinWonders Hoi An had no lines at all. However, there is an option to pay approximately 100,000 VND to skip the queue, and children under 100 cm can board for free.

The guide speaks English fluently. The boat crosses the river, and you can see various scenes of animals and wild birds on both sides with explanations. The trip includes a stop to feed the animals; we stopped to feed the giraffes, and the children enjoyed it after purchasing several vegetables for 30,000 VND. The stop lasts about 7 minutes, give or take.

After that, the trip continues to see the predators. At the end of the trip, you arrive at a souvenir shop. Next to the shop is a bird cage that is part of the safari.

Safari experience was good, feeding of giraffe, small animal zoo and birds cave 👍

That's unfourtainly all positive and the buffet was high level for only 80k vnd extra

Rest of park especially waterpark dated, need certain weight and amount of people to do it, water wave was really extra low, slow river was so slow I wanted to sleep in it 🤣

4d cinema OK
Mountain cinema booring but chilled seating and hey you gotta walk a bit and enjoy the view, all in all good park and affordable with 600k and 680k with buffet which I highly recommend it was great!

Rides etc were closed due to rain

data.formatted_address: 67 Trần Quang Khải, Street, Hội An, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: Local Buddy Tours - Booking Office

reviews.text: We had a fantastic tour. Our guide was very informative. He took time to show us everything and wasn't in a rush. The place he chose for dinner after was delicious. Our driver was good made you feel safe in a crazy city with so much traffic

Our experience with Travel Buddy was absolutely fantastic! The tour guides were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, making our exploration of various fascinating places even more enjoyable. What truly stood out was the diversity of destinations we visited. Each spot had its own unique charm, from historical sites to captivating natural landscapes. It was evident that Travel Buddy had put careful thought into crafting an itinerary that kept us engaged at every turn. We enjoyed so much and my son has now experience the country side life. In summary, Travel Buddy provided us with an exceptional travel experience. With their friendly guides and captivating destinations, we couldn't have asked for a better adventure. Definitely will come back to Hoi An and Travel Buddy in the future!

Local buddy tours worked really well for us.
Well worth the time and money.
Our buddy was Thanh, he was a great ambassador for Hoi An & Da Nang. Knowledgeable, friendly & engaged with the story's we all take away .
His family are welcome to NZ any day hospitality included!
The organic gardens were beautiful, our Water wheel lunch was delicious 😋 I would even do it all again as so much to take in..
Our day was well spent and I highly recommend making a buddy to really get the feel for this lovely area of Vietnam.

Picked a wonderful day for our Ba Na Hills tour, not a cloud in the sky so a fantastic view from the top. Sunny our tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and very funny 😄 we didn’t want to do the theme park so went for a river cruise in Hoi An old town with a beautiful Vietnamese lunch to finish. One of our best days so far. Thank you Local Buddy tours you were fabulous 👍😊

We ordered a Jeep Tour to see the Marble Mountain and Monkey Mountain. First of all, our guide Lanh, was outstanding and very knowledgeable about everything we visited. Such a deep understanding of Vietnamese culture, history, tradition and religion. He also communicated well in English. During our travel we felt comfortable with AC, cold drinks, comfortable seating and friendly and experienced drivers.

Lahn also went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and had a good time. Excellent guide and trip!

data.formatted_address: 69 Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Sơn Phong, Hội An, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: Tan An Market

reviews.text: Terrific fresh produce at great prices. Even for foreigners!  Parking is a little limited but there’s always room close by.
Very clean market. Great looking produce. Enjoyed little pork and seafood pancakes there.
Good price for water. There is a wide variety of goods to purchase here. Good location with plenty of parking in the front.

One of the reasonably priced market near old town. A place locals really frequent.

There's even nice mini marts, coffee shops, fruit stalls scattered nearby.
A real Asian market, very crowded, pretty close to getting most of what you want, low prices, plenty of atmosphere 😀
