data.formatted_address: V8H3+HXJ, Thanh Hà, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Chợ Thanh Hà

reviews.text: Whole sale seafood market
Fresh fish with cheap price. You can buy many types of fish. You should come here in the early morning to get the fresher fish.
A bustling fish market. I went from 3:30-4:30am. Quite crowded...

The action starts at 2 am, but the market runs till 6:30 am (ish). An easy bike ride from Hoi An (find the small road along the river) you can get a true flavor of the market at 5:30 - 6:30 am. There is a lot of drama in the buying and selling if you look hard enough!

My wife was charged 20K Dong for 2 oranges by one vendor, a few stalls away I was charged 5K for 1 orange, after being advised it was a lot cheaper to buy in kg so I know I didn't get the best price, but my wife was ripped off.

data.formatted_address: V8GM+R42, Đ. Bạch Đằng, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Street Market

reviews.text: A wonderful township to wander and admire. Lots n lots of varied stores, eateries and bars; all readily accessible. The perfect place for tailor-made clothes, shoes and accessories, at reasonable costs. And again the FOOD!!!

It's full on streets of markets and stalls, selling anything from clothing, suites to tea pots to toys and flying plastic birds 🐦.
If you love the hustle to get a bargin. You'll love it down here.

Beautiful ancient old quarter town in Hoi An... In the day, is really burning 🥵... walk street full of tailor shops/ souvenirs and handicrafts/ huge, amazingly designed market/ leather goods, shoes & sandals/ restaurants & cafes/ full of counterfeit goods etc etc... Stores  sell the same products, make sure u see few stores before u decide to buy, even the shop houses store, make sure u cut the price by half before u purchase... A way to see "the way of life" of Vietnam at the wet market which sell lot of seafood / vegetable etc etc, (have doubts is it still fresh under the hot sun)
One of, if not the best street markets we have been to, lots of variety. Lovely people. Great day out. Lots of colour and action. Drink stops along the way.
One of, if not the best street markets we have been to, lots of variety. Lovely people. Great day out. Lots of colour and action. Drink stops along the way.

data.formatted_address: Vietnam, 194 Lê Thánh Tông, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Ba Le Market

reviews.text:
Ba Le Market is a “local neighborhood” market patronized by local Vietnamese and ex-pats. I do my daily shopping here. This wet market has cheaply-priced produce ranging from fresh fruits, fresh vegetables, fresh herbs, fresh meats, fresh seafood, spices, soy and coconut oil, and dry goods. You can find whatever you need here. I come early in the morning for the freshness of vegetables, spices, herbs, meats, and seafood.

Visit Stall #10, run by a mom and son team, please ask for Mr. Han, who speaks English quite well. Stall 10 is similar to other stalls, but it is the only stall that carries olive oil; and Stall 10 carries organic produce, please ask Mr. Han.
Authentic vietnamese market. I don't think it's clean and safe to eat some of their products, but it's interesting to visit it
This is an authentic local market. Come very early to get the best things.

This is the market where the locals shop. Incredible variety of fresh vegetables and fruits. Out guide Hon and her husband took us through the market where we got to try mangosteen, rambutan, loquat and many other fruits.

This market is perfect. It's here for the locals, not for some tourist. Many vendors who are selling fresh fish, meats, vegetables, etc. There are a couple vendors who sell some good morning breakfast foods and snacks. Non-food items are in the next building over. Definitely worth a visit.

data.formatted_address: 06 lăng ông, Cẩm An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Early Morning Local Market

reviews.text: An oasis away from the otherwise very touristy options in An Bàng. We had breakfast here two days in a row at two different little tables at the West end of the market. Bún mắm and bún bò were both very good, and everyone was very friendly. Also look for the lady serving fried bananas (bánh chuối) near the main road down from the market. Also be aware that this is *just* a morning market. Come much after 10am and you'll miss it.

Great little market with all the local fruit and veggies, including organic options from Tra Que.
try to come around 7:00 because then ots at its peak.
5 stars to the two businesses pictured.  Great coffee and juice.  Ate breakfast 4 days at cafe.  Lovely people and food.  Market itself plenty of fresh food.
Veg, fruit and street food. The best to come very early, 6-8am
Small but lots of stuff to see and buy. Worth checking out!

data.formatted_address: 3 Nguyễn Hoàng, An Hội, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Street food market

reviews.text: Welcome to Lantern city Ho Ian 🥗🇻🇳🥗Beautiful place to visit with awesome food options. I recommend doing the boat ride as well. Make sure you stop by the chicken rice shop as well while in Hoi An! Check out handmade lanterns which make awesome gifts in cheap price.

Bustling night market with many shops and tourists, but note that many shops are selling the same things, such as bamboo products, lanterns, handmade souvenir and food. Need to bargain as seller offer price is way to high.
Once night falls, many boats offer rides along the river and you can buy water lanterns and place them in the river. Quite a beautiful view at night

This is a fun part of the old town that comes alive at, night,
(light noise and fire) the sights/sites you see, LOL. The food OMG, from whole frogs to lobster,

Many food choices in this nightmarket.

Tips:
Don't forget to bargin if you want to buy souvenirs in this nightmarket.
I want to buy some postcards, and the owner asked for 50k per one... which is obviously too expensive. In the end I bought 5 cards for 120k (24k per one). Still a bit pricey for me and I saw other shop selling the same postcard for 15k each.......

Beautiful place to visit with awesome food options. I recommend doing the boat ride as well. Make sure you stop by the chicken rice shop as well while in Hoi An! Check out handmade lanterns which make awesome gifts

data.formatted_address: Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Local Market

reviews.text: Love this market and its atmosphere. Check out the current prices before you go though if you aren't Vietnamese!
Great market for vegetables.
It's ok.
Better at the central market, but handy.

The market size seems a bit small.
There doesn't seem to be any reason to go.
If you're Korean, the only thing you can live for is fruit.
I asked about two fruit shops, and they asked for 40,000 dong for 1 kg of mango and 70,000 dong for 1 kg of mangosteen.
I usually buy mangoes for 30,000 dong per kilo, and I tried to persuade them, but they didn't cut them until the end, so I didn't buy them. I heard that if you sell them like that somewhere else, you can still get 30,000 dong left over.
If it were me, I would sell it cheap and sell it again.
The important thing is that the market mango sold for 30,000 dong was bigger, had better color, and had a lot of juice.

data.formatted_address: V8MH+VXR, Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Sơn Phong, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Tiger Market

reviews.text: I loved this local market bereft of tourist so only locals buying fresh and clean food - fish, meat, tofu and fruit and vegetable.  The freshest and cleanest food market I have seen in Asia.

Great noises smells and fresh produce
The real Hoi Anh
Some older photos are showing meat being available there. I didn't see any in the afternoon, maybe there is in the morning hours. There's lots of produce there.
A good place to go to buy cheap clothes. Cheaper than in old town markets
We love to go to the local markets, they sell household too and shops around are reasonable priced

data.formatted_address: 14 Đ. Phan Chu Trinh, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Food Market

reviews.text: The food here was really good. I ate here at different stalls on different days. I prefer to eat local when I travel, I find it adds to the whole experience and in Hoian it's way cheaper. The ladies here are super friendly and made me feel very welcome to have me eat at their stall. Loved it. Pic is food served at the front stall near the big entrance doors.

When entering the old town a visitor could be forgiven in thinking when does the market start and finish, basically in our interpretation Chợ Hội An ( The Market Building), is where it starts, on the corner of Trần Phú and Đ. Tiểu La, from this point the first building is all food, the second building is souvenirs and stuff, also the imediate surrounds is also markets, the whole area, is chaotic, and wonderful to experience.

If you’re in Hoi An then you must try the Cao Lau! These special noodles are not readily available outside of Hoi An as it is made by rice soaked in lye water from the Ba Le well.

We visited the store patronised by Anthony Bourdain called Hai Chien. Both the Cao Lau & Fried Wonton that we ordered were tasty!
Nice market with many food stalls at very fair price. Freshly made local food. I recommend the white rose, a local dish.

A mix of food vendor and folks selling grocery items and souvenirs.  Inexpensive selection of local food vs the price in the restaurant.  Could get crowded but might be fun even if it's only to walk by and observe.

data.formatted_address: W85X+93G, Nguyễn Phan Vinh, Cẩm An, Hội An, Quảng Nam 56000, Vietnam
data.name: Tan Thanh Flea Market

reviews.text: We are here at 11.30am on a Saturday..there is 1 stall. Maybe it gets going later, but the locals in cafe say there is no market today
Awesome place to shop, eat and hang out on Saturday at the beach. Very first flea market in the area. Must visit!

Tan Thanh Market is an initiative of a group of Hoi An businesses opened after the Covid epidemic to help promote tourism and create a new playground for Hoi An.
There are many stalls here selling handicrafts, creative handmade items, local specialties or even a few bunches of home garden vegetables can be sold to help local people improve their income.
In addition to shopping at the stalls, there are many choices of restaurants, refreshments, and coastal bars where you can rest and enjoy the typical dishes and drinks of each place. The evening was quite fun with live band performances from the bars.
One more option for you every Saturday in Hoi An!
The market is held weekly with many handmade items and clean agricultural products. The market atmosphere is fun and full of exciting activities, especially with live music all day.

Tan Thanh Fishing Village Market, a place to exchange goods, buy and sell used goods, liquidated goods, local cuisine, homemade items, and very creative handmade goods.

In addition, street entertainment activities are extremely unique and fun.

The fishing village market takes place every Saturday, an indispensable destination when you visit Hoi An.

data.formatted_address: 36 Trần Quý Cáp, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Giếng cổ Hội an

reviews.text: Great little cafe and restaurant. Prices are very reasonable especially for the location!  Coconut coffee was delicious and big!  Actually one of the best coconut coffees that I’ve had in Vietnam. 😁 On a main road but still relaxing!
Ok

The well is located in front of Hoi An market, symbolizing the tradition of a riverside market in Quang region. It is called Mechanical Well because in the past the well was equipped with a type of winch to pull water. The well is also a bit of feng shui and coolness for the spaces in the market.
Cultural and historical features

data.formatted_address: 21 Hoàng Diệu, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoian Fabric Market

reviews.text: Huge market with a nice parking area for scooters. You can find nice fabric tailors and don’t hesitate to explore upstairs there’s clothes and accessories at local prices. Definitely worth the visit for the whole family

Lots of touting, especially at the main entrance. Tip: come in from the side to avoid the persistent saleswomen. For premade aodai, head straight to Ngoc LY No7 (near the stairs).. Honest seller with the cheapest price around.

Mixed experience, due to the pandemic businesses are very possessive of potential customers.
If you are approached and agree to go into the market be prepared to buy at the shop your are taken to. If you go and buy at a neighboring stall it may cause a heated argument between vendors - with you in the middle of it!
This is not to say that it is not worth while, clothing and choices are just as abundant as is the service.  But I would suggest that you research beforehand and go directly to the merchant stall you want to buy from. There are quite a few that are recommended on TripAdvisor for example.
Yes, yes you have the right to buy from anyone… but it seems that some vendors have an agreement to pay commissions to the people who draw you into their shops - not that they will tell you that - and any purchases you make at another stall can cause friction.
Brought 4 shirts from Shop 25 My Silk , great quality materials , great fit , great service and price , would recommend My Silk Shop 25

Keep your wits about you, especially at Anh's by the entrance. I was shopping for souvenirs that were 40k for one, and got it to 60k for the pair. When I came back an hour later to purchase, she was charging 60k for each (so I paid 120 instead of 60). It was my mistake because I was tired and wasn't paying attention. The building sells souvenirs, shoes, probably at a lower price than a lot of shops in the old city.

data.formatted_address: 22 Nguyễn Phan Vinh, Cẩm An, Hội An, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: Chợ Phiên Làng Chài Tân Thành

reviews.text: Great and fun
nice

[For the recovery of Hoi An and Da Nang Tourism]
📣📣 TAN THANH FISHING VILLAGE SUPER MARKET WELCOME NEW YEAR 2021 (Official event of Hoi An City)📣📣
Lucky draw with prizes up to 80 million VND.
👉 From 8am to 9pm every day from December 25, 2020 to January 2, 2021.
✔️* 100 liquidation booths, used items, homemade items...
✔️* 20 booths of antiques and collectibles of Hoi An Antiques Club.
✔️* 20 liquidation booths at shocking prices of old town shops.
✔️* Quang Nam OCOP cultural and specialties area
✔️* International New Year Festival of the foreign community (expat) in Hoi An, Da Nang.
✔️* Private area and completely free for any Hoi An or Da Nang residents to bring old or liquidated items from their homes to sell. Receive consignment of old items and accept charity items/funds to support poor people and natural disasters.
*************
✔️* Unique and cozy Christmas and New Year space
✔️* Christmas and New Year gifts & shocking prices every day (Boxing day). .
✔️* Exciting and exciting street cultural activities with the participation of Hoi An Memory Theater actors and domestic and international artists: Bai choi singing, Quang Nam folk singing, guitar, zumba street...
✔️* A rich selection of typical Hoi An and Central cuisine at very good prices and delicious food.
✔️* Lucky Draw - attractive prizes with a total value of up to 80 million VND for lucky market visitors.
👉Update details at fanpage/group Tan Thanh Flea Market Online - Tan Thanh Fishing Village Market
The market opens every Saturday and Sunday, where goods are exchanged and souvenirs are sold. There are many artistic activities.
A reasonable place to have fun and shop with many products invested in design, reasonable prices and many interesting activities.

data.formatted_address: Đào Duy Từ, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Heritage Homestay

reviews.text:
The service & the hospitality, especially Helen was impeccable. This Hotel has all the amenities of a 3 star hotel. We would highly recommend this place and will stay here again the next time we visit.
Helen treated us like family, explaining all the tours and all the places we could go and made all our arrangements for us, including motorbike rental and reservations for a boat tour
They even prepare breakfast for us the night before because we were leaving early the next day

I highly recommend this hotel. Our room was clean, spacious, and the wooden furniture was immaculate. The people running the hotel were very friendly and helped us with anything we needed such as getting a taxi or having laundry done. The breakfast was yummy and filling. It’s located within walking distance of the old quarter, however very peaceful and quiet.

Very clean and spacious hotel and room... Delicious breakfasts! Very comfy bed and pillows and very polite and friendly staff. Great location, easy walk to the main city centre/ markets etc. The hotel is beautifully tiled thoughout but this means it was quite noisy in the mornings and we had some ants in our room (as long as all food was put in the fridge, this didn't bother us)

The receptionist organised a private driver to take my partner and I to Danang airport for 250 000 VND which was fantastic! (We paid 400 000 VND for a Grab (uber) to take us from the airport to this hotel) so I'd highly recommend getting them to organise a driver 😊

Nice quiet place close enough to old quarter without being in the middle of the noise. Birds chirping ourside your window. There are only 7 rooms here so it feels spacious. AMAZING iced coffee free at breakfast. Super nice host family, free bike loan and cheap scooter rental next door.

Great hotel. Not really a homestay though it's run by a family. Very nice staff. Clean rooms. Wish we had stayed longer. Hotel manager very sweet man accompanied us to our taxi with two umbrellas since it was pouring outside.

data.formatted_address: V8GQ+3PF, Cồn Hến, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Công viên Ấn tượng Hội An

reviews.text:
The Graceful & Exuberance dancers, the colourful costumes, life-size props, outdoor water amphitheatre, lively music add up to the enchantment of the show.
Wonderful peek into the past,present & future of lively Hoi An.
The ushers are helpful & welcoming too.
Fully Recommended.

This place was totally worthbthe visit. It has a lot of dance and acting shows explaining the history of Hoi An and the culture of Vietnam at the same time. Should not miss the main show, it was amazing!
We booked the VIP seats and I recommend those for the ones who need a little cooling with the fans or want to eat some fruits while enjoying the show.

Very nice place if you want to go see the evening show. It is quite expensive 600k dong but we got 20% discout before on the street still 480k dong. Quite a lot but you get a free meal of 55k value inside and the show is quite special with beautiful stage and amazing lighting. There is an option if you come in just for small pre shows for 100k. Those are nice as well and you get to see the inside. In the main event there are around 80 actors involved so a lot of places to look. They have english subtitles for the story which describes Hoi an trough history with local legends.

Overall i though it was quite spectacular and i am not easily impressed. Good night out if you can get over the high price.
This is the place that you have to visit one time when come to Hoi An city. The impressive is the show memories of Hoi An. We have to say that is so impressive with the show.
Good location for Hoi An experience. Show is wonderful

data.formatted_address: 01 Đường Cao Hồng Lãnh, st, Hội An, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: The Center for Culture and Sports of Hoi An city

reviews.text: Just a big open space in front of the buildings where many tourist busses do their drop off. From here the tourist area is just a short walk away along the river. I am not sure if the building is open to public.
This place is more like a public yard. Nice view here with some street food but they are not really delicious. There is a beautiful walk path from here to Japanese Bridge.
Hoi An is amazing destination to visit, I think this website give many useful information about Hoi An !
Need to check for activities. None while there. Most unfortunate.
It's ok

data.formatted_address: 6 Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Nhà trưng bày Văn hóa Nhật Bản - Japanese Culture Gallery

reviews.text: If you want to experience a Japanese tea ceremony, you need to go there at 16:15 and specifically request it. They will set it up to start at 16:30 for you. It costs 50,000 dong per person and you try some matcha tea with a traditional green bean Japanese sweet. It is fairly short but a nice experience.
No times for tea ceremony, the reception just rudely told us at 4 that we should come at 9:30
Small but very pretty, most people walk past it? Also careful on the second floor there are things you can trip over.
If you want to go to the tea ceremony check beforehand to make sure they’re doing it. It’s not every day.
Excellent collection of Japanese artifacts. A history of trade relation between Japanese and Vietnamese going back to the 15th Century in the trade city of Hoi An

data.formatted_address: 149 Trần Phú, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Museum of Sa Huynh Culture

reviews.text:
It's fair to say that this museum is reasonably niche, but it does have good English translations if you find pottery interesting. Oddly the views of the roof and river from the second floor were my highlights
Note the exit is an air conditioned cafe if that's important to you...
One ticket to enter. Lots of items on display from burial site. Have a great view on both end of the balconiss.
Mainly interesting if you love archeology as the exhibits look very similar to each other.
No entrance fee for visitor. There are two floors for exhibitions and you can look at the street from the balcony of the museum. A cafe is also connected to the museum.
Like all other museums in town the most interesting is the building itself.

data.formatted_address: 66 Đ. Bạch Đằng, Old Town, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Traditional Art Performance House

reviews.text:
A small theater where you can see this show. It consists of 5 short stories. Nice to watch in between other activities during a tour. However, it's not comparable to The Memory Show.

We had a good time, and that's what matters.
It's a good show with 5 acts. it's a nice place to enjoy a bit of aircon for 30 minutes before heading back out under the scorching heat.
It was included with the tickets we had already bought for other attractions so we checked it out, was a fun finale to a full day of sightseeing. Really enjoyed it
Definitely good idea to mix this in to use one of the 5 Heritage tickets for. You get to see traditional Vietnamese dance and theatre performances as well as to play bingo.

Worth checking out as part of the tourist ticket. Definitely the best value for money of everything we saw with this. Fun to see some traditional performances and the theatre is comfortable and well air-conditioned.

data.formatted_address: 64 Trần Phú, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Chinese Assembly Hall of Hoi An

reviews.text: Very interesting mixture of chinese and vietnamese history. In the heart of Hoi An old town but still not overcrowded in September. Not just a tourist attraction and it's for free.
Situated in the old town, this was a good stop over for some photo. Nothing much to see inside, I won’t come here just to look at this place.
Fascinating place. Free entry.
Fairly sure this isn't the one you're looking for, but there's no ticket required for entry.
The roof of the temple has the architectural feature of southern Fujian - swallowtail, which is antique, but the cleanliness is not well maintained, and the front hall has a strong smell of urine.

data.formatted_address: 52 Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Cẩm Phô Communal House / Cẩm Phô Temple

reviews.text: The Communal House is one the place you can visit after getting the Hoi An Entry Pass. It's calm and serne with beautiful shirne dedicated to the deities,  amazing paintings and incense hanging from the roof. Additional as i went on an Thursday afternoon there was a small music practice session by locals which just added an extra charm to the place. In evening as it is being lit my candles and small rice lights , the place becomes more beautiful.

Cam Pho Communal House is one of the more than 20 cultural attractions in Hoi An that embodies pure Vietnamese architecture. Although there may not be as much to see here as in other locations, it is recommended a visit to support the sole employee who oversees ticket sales, maintenance, gardening, and providing information to visitors about the communal house. As he works alone, he rarely takes a break, viewing his job as more of a community service than regular employment.
Place is simple. Not much happening. It’s a quick stop. Not super well maintained, but still charming. Worth the ticket if you got the city deal of 5 and still has something pending.
The ticket person is very nice. There is a washroom inside. It is small inside the place though.
This is a relic of Hoi An city, visitors can visit to discover more interesting things.

data.formatted_address: Cẩm Kim, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Chốn quê Garden

data.formatted_address: Tổ 17 thôn Phước Trung, Cẩm Kim, Tp. Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: ST Garden - Vườn Sinh thái Hội An

data.formatted_address: Yết Kiêu, Cửa Đại Ward, Cửa Đại, Hội An, Quảng Nam 51000, Vietnam
data.name: Bellerive Farm

reviews.text: Super high-quality waiters, lovely, huggable and approachable.
The bed was great, the space was big, the TV was big, the bathtub was big, the swimming pool was fun, and the breakfast was delicious.

data.formatted_address: Cẩm Hà, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Vietnam Animal Aid and Rescue

data.formatted_address: Tổ 4/Thôn Vạn Lăng, Cẩm Thanh, Hội An, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: Hacoconut Coconut Basket Boat

reviews.text: I would really recommend Hacoconut - the lady in charge is lovely, not pushy, very welcoming and gives you a bottle of water. We didn’t book and went at 4:30 and she was so accommodating! We had a brilliant time for our boat tour! The guides are so fun, friendly and incredible photographers. You can be spun around out on the lake for an extra 100,000 but we didn’t feel the need. The gentle row down the river, seeing all the trees and trying to catch bright purple crabs was enough of a lovely experience!

Amazing experience! Loved every bit of it. Just make sure guys to help out with paddling when the wind is pushing you the other way.

The price was right. They will tell you to put on life jackets too because if you don't they will get a fine from boarder security. You can always whats app them. They have english.

I came by motorbike and there were at least 3 motor bikes following me and asked to come to their area. Just make sure you arrived at this spot meet the man on that photo.

We had a really great experience in this boat tour. The price is reasonable and most probably the only place wher they wont charge you triple just for being a foreign tourist. The woman who received us Was also very friendly and nice. Highly recommended! 💪✌️🫰

SO much fun, SO CHEAP! Beautiful trip along the river and through the trees! Life jackets, authentic hats and a brolly on the boat waiting, free of charge. Crabbing on the way back and refreshments where we started. Great price and a lovely, friendly service.

Had a very speedy WhatsApp response and then within 10 minutes we were being picked up from our hotel. The pickup and drop-off fee was very reasonable and the boat itself was 100,000 dong per person which is a good price compared to many others I'd looked at. The boat drivers themselves were great fun!

data.formatted_address: V9HF+94R, Cẩm Thanh, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoian CoconutForest Tour

reviews.text: When visiting Vietnam, one shouldn't miss going to the Coconut forest in Hoi An. The boat ride is around an hour and is very picturesque. The music being played and the live singing is worth a watch.

Had a great experience doing the Coconut Forest Tour. Our guide was really friendly, and didn’t spin us around like crazy (since we asked him not to). He took us around the forest and caught a few small crabs.

Is a very mid experience if you don’t pay the boat guy 100k VND to spin you around . The water is poor quality and you are definitely overpaying for the trip . Be sure to be wary of what you tip at the end of the ride to the driver , they will try to coerce a tip of 100k VND out of you to pay the driver even though you did just pay 300k VND or more for the trip , but okay no problem, why must be coerced into tipping even though the ride was not enjoyable or fun . 🥲

Best enjoyment while in boating to the coconut forest and in midst, they did some stunts 😁Very good place to relax the body and mind! And you can try coconut soup and coconut water after completing the boat ride, it will be a boost to next ride

The boat ride offered a picturesque view and was a delightful experience. We also enjoyed the rain during our excursion. However, it is worth noting that there are additional charges for the boat ride in the middle section, where the boat takes a circular route.
So must bargain there. And enjoy the ride.

data.formatted_address: 35-27 Nguyễn Tri Phương, Cẩm Nam, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Cam Nam Island

reviews.text: Few nice coffee shops on the island. Nice walk across the bridge.
Cross the bridge with care and about 200 metres on your left a little stand selling salt coffee by a grandma...WOW was delicious 😋
Best island in Hoi An

The air is cool and fresh because it is an oasis near Hoi An ancient town. It only takes 5 minutes to walk from the island to Hoi An market, so shopping and going to the market is very convenient. The seafood market opens from 3am, the food is very fresh and delicious at good prices, so anyone who likes seafood can get up early to go to the market and see the very chill city. In addition, a place that cannot be missed on the island is the Hoi An Memory Show. An outdoor real-life show with elaborate and majestic sound, light and stage investment gives the audience a memorable experience of Hoi An many years ago. Thank you very much
Very quiet island without places of interest but good to know how the Vietnamese live

data.formatted_address: 81 Huyền Trân Công Chúa, Hoà Hải, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: The Marble Mountains

reviews.text:
Had lots of good views. Had a good workout climbing in and out. Was very enjoyable but  it’s kind of work out and hot sunny day .sweat out.Overpriced marble souvenirs but the short hike was worth it.

Interesting place to go,
I’d choose a cooler day in hindsight but still well worth it.
I’d also recommend doing as part of a tour group as you’ll learn a lot more and they’re super cheap so there’s no reason not to.
Lots of steps and I though really not that bad if you struggle from the couch to fridge this isn’t a activity for you, but normal people should be fine just take water, though in saying that there  is vendors up the top as well and an elevator.
Make sure you go to the bottom are first “hell” as it very interesting natural cave
Cheers

Fascinating caves with carvings hewn from the stone inside. Beautiful view of the river from the top. Touristy at the entry way and very busy, but even busy, the caverns are grand enough to be enjoyed. For a fun challenge, walk up the staircase at the ticket counter rather than taking the elevator.  Buddhist temples were beautiful, and modernized with neon lights! Surprising. Easy to get around -- just buy a ticket. No tour guide needed.

Highly recommend a visit here.
We arrived approx 8.00am and it was perfect timing before the tour buses turned up

Personally I found the cave the best, you paid 20k entry to this one.
It was mind blowing.

Loads of marble items for sale down the bottom of the hill.
My advice, buy from someone who has a stall on the side of the road, prices are way better

Quite nice.
Leafy on top.
I really like the layers of history so some of the Buddha statues were newer than others.
A bit strange having an elevator tacked on to a historical site. But I guess I can understand them wanting to create access but not sure that would be preferred in other heritage places.
I wish I found it a bit weird the way they put LED lighting strips inside the biggest cave around the altars.
There are toilets on the top and you can buy coconuts to drink.
Overall quite nice.

Very beautiful and interesting piece of nature. We first went inside the cave thinking that is was the main tourist attraction of the mountain. However after going up the lift we soon can to realise it wasn’t. The steps can be very dangerous especially when it’s raining. Beware of the vendors at the bottom of the mountain, they will be waiting. One follow us for about 200 meters after we repeatedly told her we don’t have enough space. It is a nice place and I will recommend come here if you like the stair master. There are things to see if you do not like steps as well.

data.formatted_address: Bình Minh, Thăng Bình District, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: Vinpearl

reviews.text:
Wonderful place for a family holiday. Beachside, incredible attentive and friendly service and an absolute better of a buffet breakfast!

Very nice cocktails and bottomless fried peanuts in the rooftop lounge bar, take advantage of happy hour(s).

The pool was far too much like a warm bath, though, perhaps a western-centric view, or perhaps it's because of the heat and it's so shallow, it's not refreshing at all. Very humorous, however, seeing our eastern relatives in full swimsuits and life jackets to take a hesitant dip in a 3 foot deep warm bath.

We are very satisfied of the service and the resort. Very nice staff. Good restaurant. Big main swimming pool. Beautiful villa (we rented a villa with private swimming pool). My children love this place.

Our family really enjoy the resort.  We stay at one of the villas.  Our family had dinner at An Restaurant.  It was amazing.  Food was great.  Super friendly staff.  Our waitress (Yên) was very kind and helpful.  We enjoyed our conversation with her while she helped us preparing the BBQ meat.  We highly recommend this resort and An restaurant if you are tired of the buffet.

Great hotel with all the facilities.  Hardworking and friendly staff.  Vin Wonders was a great extra!
Definitely will be back.
Met Thanh Day on lifeguard duty.  Hardworking and wonderful guy.
I had a brief stay, but it was a beautiful experience. The resort has golf cart access to vinwonders which was convenient. Room was very spacious and comfortable. Service was also excellent.

data.formatted_address: 303 Đ. Tuy Nhạc, street, Hội An, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: An Bang Sea Adventure homestay

reviews.text:
I stayed at Am Bang Sea Adventure for 1 week and was very happy with my time at their home stay.

Tram was a wonderful host and made sure that I was taken care of in every way possible.

She arranged both pick up and drop off at the airport, took care of my laundry, provided great breakfast, and tips for exploring Hoi An!

The room was very comfortable and has everything you need. I only had great nights of sleep here.

The beach is a very short walk away which makes it easy to come and go as you please. This also gives easy access to the many beachfront restaurants and cafes.

The old town is a short and cheap grab ride away, giving you the best of both worlds In Hoi An. Alternatively they provide bicycles at no charge if you choose to ride into town through the rice fields.

Although the home stay is close to the main road, it is still quiet and you will not be bothered!

I will definitely stay here again and can highly recommend staying here when visiting Hoi An.

We loved it so much we extended our stay from 3 nights to 9 nights! Tram, the owner, provides an exceptional warm experience and is a one-of-kind host. The property is clean, quiet and perfectly located only a short walk to the beach, and its charming village and restaurants.  Tram assisted us with trains, drivers, spa appointments, and also has scooters available to rent, which were perfect for the 10 minute drive to Hoi An city and markets. But the highlight of every day was Tram’s breakfast with many flavourful options, but always included fresh fruit and juice. So yummy! We highly recommend this Homestay and can’t wait to return!

A friend and I stayed here for 3 nights last week and had a great time. The location is excellent, very close to an Bang beach and Hoi an. The room was perfect and the breakfast was really excellent. The staff were very friendly and gave us great advice on what to see during our stay. They also helped us organise various activities and bike rentals. Highly recommend this place, one of the best stays I’ve had in Vietnam so far 👍🏻

I can honestly say that An Bang Sea Adventure Homestay is the best accommodation I’ve ever stayed at.  I loved the location, the room, the free breakfast, the amenities, the value and most of all the warmth and hospitality that Ms. Tram and her family offered.

I stayed in a huge, beautiful room that had everything I needed. Outside, there was a table and lounge chair overlooking the pool.  It was very peaceful. Breakfasts were huge, freshly cooked and delicious.  There were multiple options and I chose a new one every day.  I just needed to send a text and it would be ready in 5 mins.  The beach and a tonne of restaurants  were a quick walk away.  Bikes were available and free, I  could easily bike into Hoi An ancient town or use the Grab app.  There was lots to see and do in town.  The warmth and helpfulness of Ms. Tram and her family was excellent.  She helped me plan my trip and my transportation.  It was a great experience.  Thank you!

Had a lovely stay here with Tram and her family. She helped us with everything we needed and was flexible to all the requests we had. Rooms were clean and comfortable and had a smaller area outside to eat and relax with privacy.

The breakfast was great, especially the fresh fruit! It is a short walk to the main an bang beach which was very pleasant.

data.formatted_address: R8XW+QM6, Duy Vinh, Duy Xuyên District, Quảng Nam 51300, Vietnam
data.name: Hoian wildlife tours

data.formatted_address: ”Hidden Beach” Hoi An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: ”Hidden Beach” Hoi An

reviews.text: I’m sure this spot is normally quite nice and secluded but it seems there is some construction happening at the moment. Our view was mostly this work equipment and it was quite noisy. Just a heads up for those traveling sometime soon.
It is a beautiful, quiet and more local beach compared to other beaches in Hoi An or Da Nang. You can take out smoothies from nearby cafe where has a free parking for bikes.

A beautiful small and clean beach, with a few people.
If you buy lunch at the near restaurant your sunbed is for free or else it's just 20.000. I ordered Tofu with vegetables and rice for 85.000 and a beer for 25.000, so very fair prices and the food was fresh and very tasty 😀👍
A hidden little beach located in a small alley. Free motorbikes parking. Staffs are friendly. Drinks are very good and food was ok with pizza. Chairs on beach are provided. Water is clear and clean.

Beautiful beach that can be reached with a motorbike and offers free parking. We discovered it while walking along the main beach and there was literally no one there. A very calm and peaceful place. If you are in search of some calm this place seems like a good one to be in.

data.formatted_address: 6V8V+GFW, Lộc Trì, Phú Lộc, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
data.name: Bạch Mã National Park

reviews.text: Must see Mr Cam who can help call the wild birds for you. If possible, bring high quality camera with long lenses for taking photos pf wildlife. Sunset and sunrise are fabulous. Basic accommodations but the food is great.

It’s great to be here. We spent a night at the old French Villa with no ones else, it was lucky that electricity was cut off that night . We had a so romantic day and night there with candles and no phone or internet. We very much appreciate Bach Ma National Park. We want to come back.

I had a trekking tour here last week, it was wonderful experience, both for the nature and the history about the area, all thanks to the local guide. If you come in the next months (march and april) the rhododendron plants wich the park is full should be blooming.

It is much cooler than at sea level. There was no AC nor a fan in the bedroom,  no need. If you are fit to walk in nature, this is a great place to visit. The hotel restaurant was nice with good Vietnamese dishes and cold beer. The local wine was different and not in our taste. We saw sun rising and sunset, and we were even in the clouds.

The weather here is just perfect!!! Perfect place to go hiking, swimming at waterfall on the way to the top. Beautiful beach view with a lot of protected animal… highly recommended stay a night here at the top, try out local food… will go back for peace and get away from the city

data.formatted_address: Đường Võ Chí Công, Bình Minh, Thăng Bình, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: VinWonders Nam Hội An

reviews.text:
** Location: Not far from Vinpearl resort & golf Nam Hoi An, traveling by resort's electric car.
** Fee: the location sells tickets, if you buy a combo with the hotel room price, you can play freely, go as many times as you like.
** Space: large, designed with many play areas. Taking photos is called "running out of sauce". Lots of beautiful frames here.
Play: an area with indoor play equipment, comfortable play from boxing machines, shooting machines, ball houses.... unlimited play, no need to buy coins.
** Performances: performance times are posted at the resort's front desk. Water music is performed in the evening.
** Sightseeing: on a boat safari, the tour guides enthusiastically introduce many tourist groups to the animals on both banks of the river. There is also an area for raising deer, ostriches... children can feed the animals, cups of food are sold, I don't remember clearly, it seems to be 15k/portion. There is a bird house with many colorful and beautiful birds. Large 3D image area, you can freely take photos with a variety of photo frames.
****The craft village area is extremely interesting, children can draw fans, draw masks, watch silk spinning, silkworm farming, do paper, Dong Ho paintings... many interesting activities. Kids need to walk a lot!

A must try visit place. You can enjoy traditional customs, experience the 3D mapping and music water shows. Seeing wild animals, many kinds of birds,… there are diverse street shows, magic performance is interesting

This park is strange. No crowds, no wait times for anything. There is hardly anyone there. The theme park ride are limited but considering you can go on them without out waiting, it’s pretty good. There is enough there to be fun. The water park is fun but beware, there is a weight limit for some rides. The water safari was good. Buffet was average. Shuttle buggies worth it when it’s hot. I understand rides stop when it is wet so pick your day. We went on a perfect dry day so had no issues. If you need a day out with the kids that is not eye watering expensive like Ba Na Hills then this is it. I’d recommend it but manage the kids expectations. It’s not Universal Studios!

VinWonders, located in Vietnam, is a fantastic destination for families seeking a blend of adventure, entertainment, and relaxation. Spread across various locations, including Phu Quoc, Nha Trang, and Nam Hoi An, VinWonders provides a diverse range of attractions and activities suitable for all ages.

One of the standout features of VinWonders is its wide array of themed zones, each offering unique experiences. From thrilling rides and water slides to cultural performances and interactive exhibits, there's something for everyone. Kids will particularly enjoy the Fantasy World and Water Park areas, where they can spend hours on exhilarating rides and splashing around in the pools.

The park is also known for its buffet offerings, which are both delicious and diverse. With a range of international and local cuisines, the buffet caters to different tastes and dietary preferences, ensuring that every member of the family finds something to enjoy. The quality and variety of food make it a highlight of the visit, offering a pleasant break between activities.

For budget-conscious travelers, it's worth noting that purchasing tickets online is generally cheaper than buying them at the gate. This not only saves money but also time, as it allows visitors to skip the long queues at the entrance. Additionally, online bookings often come with promotional deals and packages that can enhance the overall experience.

Overall, VinWonders is a highly recommended destination for families looking to create unforgettable memories. Its combination of exciting attractions, delectable dining options, and cost-saving ticketing options makes it a top choice for a fun-filled family outing in Vietnam.

The best theme park in the world I must say. We are family with 10, 6, and 3 years old. Tickets are free for 3 years old below , Kids tickets are cheaper . (Bought directly from website early with discount so our total family ticket was just around usd 100) . We arranged for a return ride from klook ( 30usd return trip , 20 mins from city)  but you can easily get return transfer once you arrive at the hotels too as they are so many transport company.
You cannot bring food ( as they do check the bags ) but can bring baby food/special diet and plain water . Don't think there is a stroller rental so bring your own if with kids. There is a bicycle rental option if you are without kids .
Non peak period , there is no line for any rides!  Everything under one roof . Doable to visit within a day but please take the buggy combo option( until 5.30pm only, may need to call hotline if no buggy at stop) as the park is super huge and will take time to walk .
Come around 9.30 and start with river cruise at the Safari that will take around 35 minutes. There' s a professional photographer here where u can ask them to take ur family photo with your own phone too. The printed picture is around 100k Dong. You can feed the animals for 30k dong a cup. Good activity for kids .
Then,  Take buggy to Adventure land and if u have baby and  toddler can start with a few kiddy rides ( like the boat, small ship, round swing, spinning teacup,  first in adventure land . ( there's min height each ride please check website) .
If it is too hot can stop by at the indoor park with air-conditioning ( trampoline , slides, blocks, Free arcade games!!) . There's a comfortable air cond cafe ( only donuts and drinks) here but you can buy take away snacks (french fires, fish ball,sausage)  from the restaurants outside  beside the bbq korean restaurant.
You can continue the adult rides in adventure land .( crazy ones is available too!!!)  Then visit the 4D Castle for a 15 minutes show every half hour showtime.
We didn't visit the folk culture area but you can do so as it is already near the castle.  There are also cultural show timing so please find it out. We went to the waterpark after but please keep in mind it closes at 5.30 and locker key and towels need to be returned on time if not you will not get your deposit !
There is an immersive art 3D show at the hills of mountains at 6.15pm for 15 mins show and make your way to the 30 minutes fountain show starts at 6.40pm. You can arrange your driver to go home by 7.15 pm. I hope this detailed review will help to plan your trip here .

data.formatted_address: 46 Trần Phú, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hội Quán Phước Kiến

reviews.text:
June 2nd 2024
Dedicated to the sea goddess and is part of Chinese Heritage in Vietnam. Whilst the artifacts and architecture was beautiful, it did not require a long visit at this location. We gave up quickly and found a nice brewery just down the road.
Is a must to see in Hoi An. A very beautiful and unique masterpiece. There's lots of people all the time there but the vibe inside is fantastic and it's definitely worth visiting the place.

Another chinese clan association attraction which again is not a temple but a place to worship your ancestors who are placed here in the ancestors tablet room. It has nice classical chinese architecture. You need a ticket to enter the building.
I loved this place! It is large, ornate, plenty of great photo ops, and beautiful flowers and vegetation.
We love it here. Very nice city and so much to do here. Love the food, people, and culture.

data.formatted_address: 203 Lý Thường Kiệt, Phường Cẩm Phổ, Hội An, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: The Castle Spa

reviews.text: This is a massage experience like never before. I really enjoyed myself. Staff are friendly and sweet. They are truly committed to providing a comfortable environment for us. They are very skillful and will ensure u get maximum relaxation during the massage by asking if the pressure is right, along with some relaxing music. the experience ends with some tea and mango (which was very yummy).  I went twice, and it has left me wanting more. I will definitely come again when i am in vietnam.

Fantastic massage experience. Never have I felt so satisfied after a massage session. The receptionist will warmly welcome you to the outlet with a friendly smile and nourishment while you wait for your turn. I chose the normal oil massage while my wife had the thai massage, both for 90 minutes. The masseuse were very professional, adjusting the strength depending on your preference. After the treatment, they provided us with a sweet mango treat and ginger tea. With their very reasonable price, definitely recommended to all
Wonderfull Spa, very nice people and staff. Besides that, excellent massages and techniques. Clean Spa, great service before, while and after your massage. Will definitely recommend!

First rate massage! Front desk was very professional and courteous. The masseur Ya Nga was able to accede to my request to go harder or less strong. Excellent service. The mango dessert was a huge surprise bonus. Will come back again!
The massage place is very perfect and professional. The price is affordable. the food and drinks are delicious. the massage staff is very professional. highly recommended

data.formatted_address: 186 Trần Phú, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Chùa Cầu

reviews.text: When i have visited this place is not open.. it was under repair work.. i think i have missed this.. but the real beauty is not this.. just go forward you can see  lantern market as well as  lantern boat ride.. this is the relay beauty.. must visit this bridge

Chùa Cầu, also known as the Pagoda Bridge, is a captivating blend of serenity and architectural marvel in Hội An, Vietnam. Its gracefully arched structure, adorned with intricate carvings and vibrant colors, creates a mesmerizing sight. As you stroll across the bridge, the rhythmic flow of the Thu Bồn River beneath adds to the tranquil ambiance. The pagoda's historical significance adds depth to the experience, offering a glimpse into Vietnam's rich cultural tapestry. Whether during the day, with sunlight casting a warm glow, or in the evening when lanterns illuminate the surroundings, Chùa Cầu stands as a symbol of timeless beauty and spiritual resonance in this UNESCO World Heritage site.

Sadly it’s under renovation or something of that sort and I didn’t get to see it. Google maps did indicate that it’s temporarily closed though. Hope I’ll be back to see it someday. There’s A LOT of beautiful and fun things to do in the area so you won’t be bored
Historic place, very beautiful, its preservation is unique, worth visiting, not to be missed

Must-See Landmark in Hội An (Japanese Covered Bridge)

Chùa Cầu, also known as the Japanese Covered Bridge, is an iconic landmark you can't miss in Hoi An. It's a beautiful bridge with a unique blend of Japanese and Vietnamese architecture.

Eye-catching Design: The bridge's wooden structure, red tiles, and ornate carvings are a photographer's dream.
Historical Significance: It's a piece of living history, built by Japanese merchants in the 16th century .
Great Location: Situated in the heart of the ancient town, it's perfect for a stroll and exploring the surrounding streets.

data.formatted_address: 200 Nguyễn Tri Phương, Cẩm Nam, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Đảo Ký Ức Hội An - Hoi An Memories Land

reviews.text:
A really magical show! Beautiful outfits and fantastic use of lighting and water to produce amazing visuals! Definitely worth seeing.
VIP seats are way in the back, you would see the entire set but from a distance so if you like to see more details then just book a normal seat, the majority of the standard seats have a great view as the set is wide.
Doors open about 7:30pm for an 8pm start so get there earlier if you want to choose a seat.
Good show overall. Great stories and fantastic acting and music. If possible, I prefer performances closer to the audiences and the experience will be much better.
Wonderful show! The wheater was bad, but the staff did everything to get as much people on a dry seat.
Excellent show well presented. I enjoyed the mini shows at different locations before the main show too. Plenty of food choices and available transportation after the show.
It was our first time to Vietnam and we loved this show. One should not miss it. Beautiful story of Hoi An.

data.formatted_address: 01 Đường Cao Hồng Lãnh, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Sông Hoài Square

reviews.text: It's a very beautiful scenery..... it is nice for romantic holiday,jump into the boat full of lantern and stroll along the river with your love one.....people are friendly....I'm looking forward to visit in the future

A square from where the old town Hoi An shopping and pedestrian area begins.
It’s yellow painted houses and shop are filled with cafés and restaurants.
The touristy side of hoi an starts from here.
It’s so confusing as to where to have coffee amongst many is a difficult choice .
Ban Mie shop that Anthony Bourdain spoke about is very popular and seeks yummy Ban mies!

From 5-9.30pm, there is a a pop up Amusement park with rides for children @ 10K VND each (and a massive inflatable castle with slides) Paint figurines for 30K - 50K VND each….factor in 1hr for drying time!

Good Bamboo village atmosphere over New years eve.
Lots of food options and user friendly.
Nice place to visit, full of Lentens and colourful.

data.formatted_address: 18 Lý Thường Kiệt, Sơn Phong, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hội An Stadium

reviews.text: Christmas 24.12.2020. Every year (the last 9 year) outside in the rain. People have umbrellas and all people behind can not see. The big church inside is empty. Why not do the ceremony inside like 10 year before ?
Good. Catholic hội an
d  i m
So good
Ok

data.formatted_address: 548 Đ. Hai Bà Trưng, Tân An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Water Puppet Show

reviews.text: It was a very food experience. It is well designed and executed. Are the beginning of everything that they presented There was an explanation in English at the beginning of every scene, it was very helpful to understand what was happening. The puppets were colorful and well animated. The place offered a good view from every point to the stage.

We went to see a show as it is very traditional for Vietnam. It was okay maybe more interesting for kids. There were some impressive effects like fire breathing dragon water puppet. Worth seeing, it lasts about 30 mins and cheaper than shows in Hanoi.

We received the welcome from Uncle Ho and then the show started. It was a nice experience and each segment was also announced in English. It was fun to watch and experience a water puppet show in Vietnam.

The water puppet show is an opportunity to see traditional Vietnamese performance art.
The puppets are quaint and the stories are traditional.
I’m glad we saw it but I’m also glad the show only went for 45 minutes.

A novel cultural experience. Reminds us of times when entertainment was simpler. Genrally entertaining 35 minute show which consists of a series of short Vietnamese folklores. While there was limited English narration, it didn't really matter because it all boiled down to the skills of the puppeteers.

Overall, good value for 80k VND (40k for children under 12).

Go early to choose centre section seat at mid tier level to get the best view.

data.formatted_address: 311 Cửa Đại, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Garden Palace & Spa

reviews.text: Amazing hotel. The room is very big with big bath and the hotel is beautiful. The staff is very nice and helpful. The location in not exactly in the center but a 10 minute drive on the free bikes that they supply will get you there!

Cannot recommend this accommodation enough. We came last year and loved it so much we returned. People were kind, the rooms were spacious and clean, the pool divine. Located a short way from the old town with lots of places to eat and have coffee nearby. Family friendly too.

Very beautiful hotel and the room was spacious.  The room had it's only little space outside where you can sit and enjoy the outside air.  The room was very eloquent.  The staff were very professional and friendly.  The food was also very good along with good service.  Many other restaurants and bars outside of the hotel.  I will definitely use this hotel again.
Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The room was charming and well maintained. The staff were very attentive and courteous and there was plenty of variety at breakfast.
Our family have booked romantic dinner at hotel instead go to Old Town. We are glad with all foods and staffs here. 5 stars and recommend to you.

data.formatted_address: 80 Nguyễn Chí Thanh, Cẩm Hà, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Vườn Hồng Hội An( Phuc Nguyen Rose)

reviews.text: What an amazing asylum! Must visit! It is a perfect place to calm down and find some peace nearby HoiAn. You can go there for a walk or take a bike or bicycle. We have had a fantastic opportunity to meet the owner. What a lovely, passionate and smart woman! I have never met someone with such a love for fruit. We tasted the iconic kumquats and they were delicious! Not only tasty but super healthy too. We have had to buy some to bring it home and show it to our family.

Beautiful and peaceful coffee shop that has recently opened. They have a small shop that sells products made by local people, including herbal teas, wines, dried fruit, syrups, crackers and much more. The garden is filled with all types of beautiful flowers and is a really calm environment to relax in.

Highly recommend to visit this place when in Hoi An. This is an underrated garden and a cafe. I would recommend talking to the owner to get to know her better and her incredible story. It's not everyday you get to see kumquat grow. The owner lady is really nice, loves to receive guests and to talk about her passion. Highly recommend visiting the gift shop where you can purchase various kumquat produce.

Lovely spot to have a coffee or tea in a beautiful garden with many different seating area. The owner is a gem, so kind and sweet. They also rent 3 apartments at very affordable monthly rates. If you want a typical vietnamese experience in a garden setting get your self to this place.
Excellent spot! Great coffee, with ice tea and a bottle of water supplied in addition. Very pretty garden with lots of flowers and shady spots to relax. We will be back! Thanks, Phuc!

data.formatted_address: V9J3+J9X, Cẩm Thanh, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Garden by Rosie

reviews.text: Visited Garden by Rosie a few times and always impresses me the wonderful architectural structure. Also the gardens which has been keep authentic along with the wells. Worth a visit when visiting Hoi An.
A must visit in Hoi An

data.formatted_address: Tuấn family, Tổ 04 Thôn Trà Quế, Cẩm Hà, Hội An, Quảng Nam 51317, Vietnam
data.name: Tuấn - Organic Herb Garden Family

reviews.text: What an amazing cooking experience at this Family home! Suin & Mai were so fun, hospitable and friendly! The service was absolutely incredible, the food was so tasty and we learnt so much on the farm tour! Truly an unforgettable experience and highly recommended you visit the Tuan family when you’re in Hoi An!

Would highly recommend this experience to anyone visiting the area. Arranged for us by our tour guide, we started with a tour of the village farm, followed by a neck & foot massage, then after a demonstration we cooked local Hoi An pancake, and finished the evening with a wonderful meal.
The experience was made even better by the wonderful family & staff who were so friendly & welcoming. As the first establishment to do this in the area, 20 years ago, it’s easy to see why they are still successful.

We added this tour as part of our time in Hoi-An, great experience to see the way herbs are farmed and why they are so well known in the region. Rin was an excellent host, the cooking demonstration and inclusive lunch was really lovely. We especially enjoyed the massage and herbal foot  bath.
The family are very welcoming and well worth the visit.

Spent my whole day at a farm close to Danang in Hoian. 'Rin' was my guide and a friend now, who not only told me what they do, but also how life is out here, culture, customs, people dependability, openness and level of mutual understanding between the families, enjoyed my activities, going around this place to know more about this life, some cooking sessions and then enjoying my yummy food and as they popularly say in Vietnamese 'chitchat'..... ! Thank you rockstar RIN

We spent a very convivial afternoon with this family. Lovely people who passed on their know-how with passion. Thank you for sharing, thank you for your kindness! We'll remember you and this great time for a long time to come!

Kiss from France

data.formatted_address: Hamlet 5, Hội An, Quảng Nam 560000, Vietnam
data.name: Ylang Garden Villa

reviews.text: Very well maintained villa with many separate rooms (similar to a small hotel or AirBnB). Outdoor pool overlooking the small lake. Outdoor covered kitchen and dining area for groups. Walking distance to a market and a tap hoa. Everything is clean and in good repair, but is not new. Comfy bed.

Expensive relative to the area, but super beautiful and clean. Spent 2 months here with a group of friends during covid 19! The staff probably deserves an extra star for dealing with us - but they kept the place clean and served daily breakfast throughout. Rooms and bathrooms are modern, nice clean pool, and really good outdoor kitchen/ grill area. Right on the river, and in a pretty good location halfway between old quarter and the beach. Kind of a random location, but the villa is it’s own destination, in a way, and it does split the difference between the two main areas for tourists. Plus, free bikes available to get around town, and motorbikes available for rent.

Confortable quiet place. Friendly staff. Great view. Swimming there at night is priceless.
Update (28/06/2017) : still my favourite stay in Hoi An :)
The employees working here were so nice. I enjoyed the rooms and riding bicycles that they provide.
My house live next to Ylang, here is good view and peaceful place.

data.formatted_address: Khu Đô thị Hà My Đông A, Điện Bàn, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Sky-Line Hill

reviews.text: Good.
Friendly environment, airy space with lots of green trees. Modern facilities. It's great that my child can study and develop here❤️❤️❤️

What I like most when entering this Sky-Line school is the modern, clean, beautiful and airy facilities with a play area for children. If I let my child study here, I feel very secure about the school's teaching methods. There are many good and useful activities besides traditional learning content. In general, the school is OK

My family has 2 children who both attend preschool at Sky-Line. My little one is a bit shy and quiet, but after studying at Sky-Line, he becomes more active and cheerful. I am very impressed with the school's teaching method, I see that the children are much more proactive and independent.

The school has many facilities, making it easy to find a place near home to study. There is a safe shuttle if parents are busy. Cute teacher, dedicated to taking care of each child. Very secure for my child to study

data.formatted_address: 33 Hoàng Diệu, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam 51300, Vietnam
data.name: Skyline Tailor

reviews.text: Had an amazing experience with Dung! She is so fun and friendly and made the experience really enjoyable. Very happy with my new tailored clothes. All finished in 24 hours and fair prices!

Really great first tailoring experience here! The process was really fun and relaxed and my top and trouser set was finished after 24hrs - no adjustments needed. Would definitely recommend :) Also had a skirt made for a friend which there was perfect despite the friend not being here.

I would like to emphasise how friendly, funny and positive the owner of this place is. This one star is for their character, because I really felt good when dealing with them. However, here comes the negative part. I chose this tailor place based on a recommendation. I wanted to get a bikini for surfing - modern looking but sportsy and practical for water sports. I had prepared pictures of my dream model, unfortunately, I was told that this tailor can't do it exactly as I wished. I was okay with it and agreed on how the swimsuit can be made with adjustments. The model was two-layered, with high-waisted bottom and sports-bra-like top with crossed straps in the back.

I wanted my swimsuit to be made of 3 different colours (for both top and bottom part), but this was not possible either. Therefore, I chose two final colours - a light pink and a darker magenta. Also, the tailor suggested using higher quality material which is stronger but also more expensive. Since I wanted this piece of bikini to be really practical for surfing, I agreed with using the better material.

After placing the order at the tailor shop and paying the total price of $70, it took 1 day to prepare the first version of the bikini. The top was too loose, so it needed to be adjusted. I thought that the bottom part was okay, it fitted nicely when I tried it on. It took 8 hours more to adjust the top part of the bikini. When I tried it for the second time, it fitted much better and I thought no more adjustments were needed. I took my new bikini home.

At home, I realised there was a lot of unfinished work left on the swimsuit - for example, threads were sticking out of the swimsuit, padding on one side was sewn but not on the other, blue tailor's chalk was visible on the swimsuit, excess pieces of fabric were left hanging on the top of the swimsuit.  Honestly, I didn't notice these apparent details in the store, and that's why I didn't address them right away.  Only at home, in peace, with plenty of time, did I realize this and felt the first disappointment.

Although I felt a bit uneasy, I went on and tried the bikini for surfing as I was excited to see how it would perform in action. When the swimsuit got wet in the sea, I started to feel that the bottom part of the bikini is getting too loose. Not that it would completely fall down with the first wave, but it didn't stay in one place. Even when I got out of the water and just walked on the beach, I could feel how loose it was in the back. The fabric wasn't stretched, on the contrary, it gathered downwards and it's just not what it looks like.  Of course, you could say that I tried the swimsuit on and it fit me, so it's not the fault of the seamstress that it doesn't fit so well in water (or after getting wet).  However, I think an experienced seamstress would be able to advise me that I need a tighter fit for my particular type of fabric and cut when dry.  So I see it at least partly as a fault of the tailor who could not give good advice and estimate the result. I was a bit sad about it, but at the same time I blamed myself.

However, when I came back home after 1 hour of surfing, the real disappointment came. I noticed steaming seams in two places - on the top and bottom of the swimsuit. And when I gently handwashed the bikini, I could see the heavily coloured pink water flowing from it. Well, I am not a swimsuit expert, but I think that high quality material should not release so much colour. Most importantly, a tailor made swimsuit for $70 should not get loose and broken seams after 1 use.

When I summarised it in my head, I felt upset and strongly disappointed by the whole product and the state and quality in which it was delivered. I am sad about it as the owner of this tailor shop seemed so nice, but I now conclude the product I got was super overpriced and low quality. I am not in Hoi An to come and deal with it in person anymore. See the attached pictures as examples.

Very happy with this shop! My friend and I both got dresses made here and love them so much. The store owner is very sweet too and lively, which made for a funny experience. Super efficient and great quality! Would recommend!!

Got a beautiful skirt made and it fit so well. Can wear it in many different ways and play around with the style. Dung made this whole experience so wonderful and gave us the skirts the very next day.

data.formatted_address: 06 Nguyễn Thái Học, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An Art Gallery

reviews.text:
Awesome father and son team producing authentic great value local art.

Dont be fooled by the fancy galleries in Hoi An, if you are staying in or near Cua Dai look no further step into the rustic shop and see what you might find.

Delighted to share here how the art looks now we have had it framed at home here in Scotland.

This gallery was great place to visit. Its very beautiful traditional temple and there are many beautiful paint arts here. I have visited many times while I stayed Hoi An. Also, the staff Vy, she is very kind and has good sense.
I bought some arts who painted by local people. And its very easy to bring back home because Vy packaged it very politely.
I did an art class here and the woman was lovely, she helped me and was patient. Highly recommend as an activity to do in Hoi an!!

We bought 2 very lovely paintings by different artists in February. I do not remember the name of the woman who helped us but she was super nice and gave us information on the artists. Beautiful place.
I did a painting class here today. Vy was great, very kind and helpful! I really enjoyed it and really relaxing and fun thing to do!! Recommend it a lot!

data.formatted_address: city, 02/ 06 Lê Lợi, str, Hội An, Quảng Nam 00051, Vietnam
data.name: ART HOUSE HOI AN GALLERY

reviews.text: Such a hidden gem in the art world! Every pieces are handcrafted by the artist themselves. I can’t recommend this gallery enough for anyone on the hunt for something truly special while visiting Hoi An!!!
Really beautiful art work and the friendliest woman working there. Such a nice spot in the old town, why not pop in!

I recently visited this gallery on a trip to Hoi An. This was the most unique gallery I found in the city, and it was truly delightful to visit with Ahn, the creator of many of the works, and his colleagues. Highly recommend this studio to anyone looking for something unique, captivating and authentic.

Recently visited this art gallery and was thoroughly impressed by the stunning collection of artworks. Each piece was captivating, showcasing a diverse range of styles and eras. The overall experience was enhanced by the gallery's serene ambiance, making it a perfect spot for art enthusiasts and casual visitors alike. A special shoutout to Julie, who was incredibly helpful and lovely, adding a personal touch to the visit with her knowledge and enthusiasm for art. Highly recommend this gallery for anyone looking to immerse themselves in a world of artistic beauty.
Love, love, loved this place! We had beer at 30,000 a bottle and enjoyed the art work around us! My favourite little place in Hoi An.

data.formatted_address: 155 Trần Phú, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: HAHA - Art In Everything

reviews.text: The HAHA Art Gallery seems to be stuck in a time warp, with its designs remaining virtually unchanged for many years. While I am a big advocate for supporting local businesses and artists, my recent visit left me feeling underwhelmed. Despite the gallery's offerings being undeniably beautiful, I found myself only able to select three small cards, leaving me yearning for a breath of fresh air in the form of innovative and captivating new artworks. What truly dampened my experience, however, was the staff's persistent surveillance during my visit. Their overbearing presence made me feel more like a suspected shoplifter than a valued customer.

Amazing place to get unique souvenirs! The staff is very attentive, the store has fixed prices and the products created by the local artist Ha Duong are very distinctive. Very happy with my new print on rice paper :)
Purchased unique artwork at amazing prices. Great gallery and helpful staff.

Lovely small art shop with heaps of cool designs from a local artist. Not just the average stuff you find elsewhere! They also sell artsy movie posters, souvenirs and clothes. All very tasteful, good prices and you get discounts on certain things. Nice lady working here, thank you!
Great shop! The artwork is by a local Vietnamese artist on magnets, rice paper, bookmarks, sketch/note books etc. Prices are reasonable and it's worth visiting.

data.formatted_address: 124 Đ. Trần Cao Vân, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Nam Trân Art Craft Village

reviews.text: Stumbled on this store by chance, and I loved it. Spend an hour looking at all the different ceramics that are unique and most of them old. The owner, told me about the different pieces I asked about, and was very nice. Price range from 10.000 dong - several million, depending of age and worth of the pieces. Ended up buying this lovely bowl

Perfect place to go treasure hunting and to find beautiful and unique presents, from cups to plates to basically anything! The store has 2 floors and it’s run by a mother and daughter, who share the passion for pottery and are ready to help if needed (it’s definitely not easy to choose so it can come handy😄)

Firstly the name is not reflective of the name.

If you are expecting an art craft village then all you will get is a shop selling ceramic and bowls! The name is completely misleading to what turns out to be a tiny shop with bowls, ceramic and some Japanese bowls.Owner was at the counter and just looks at you without any greeting.

Nothing much to look at, took 2-3 minutes and decided there wasn’t anything of interest!

Definitely not an art craft village which gives the impression of multiple shops / stalls .
Just stumbled upon this one evening by chance. Bach has an impressive ceramics collection in this little shop. Incredible hidden treasure.

This is wonderland for ceramics lovers! A charming house full of beautiful ceramics, the shop owner is a kind family. Prices are more than fair. We fell in love and ended up spending a few hours in here. Our biggest recommendations!

data.formatted_address: 180 Trần Phú, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Gallery 180

reviews.text: The owners are very very kind and patient. They pulled out a chair for me and helped me go through all of the paintings in the size I was looking for. Even though I took ages to pick one they were still very patient had a smile on their faces! I have been to other galleries in Hoi An and sometimes gallery staff follow you around and get pushy and visibly annoyed when you don’t buy anything, but you won’t get that kind of service here! Only genuine friendliness and helpfulness!

Amazing paintings and lovely people.
We recently purchased 2 paintings from here.   Have just had them framed and they are now hanging on our wall in NEW ZEALAND.
Will forever remind us of the beautiful
town Hoi An.
Thankyou so much for the lovely art work.  We could have purchased more as they are all so amazing.

We visited a lot of art galleries around the area and this was the best. Nicest people, and spent time showing us everything. They wrapped up the paintings nicely for travel. They even unwrapped and rewrapped our paintings after we decided to get another painting after we had our first one already wrapped.

We visited multiple galleries and Gallery 180 had both the nicest owners and best prices. Start here before looking at others.

They have a lot of paintings in the back. So if there is something you like, they can bring out others that are similar.

This picture is now hanging in northern Germany after our visit in January 2023. A great memory of our stay in Hoi An and our time in Vietnam. Many thanks to the owners and the artist - we are thrilled! In our opinion, absolutely recommended. The transport was also completely uncomplicated through the airports. Thank you very much and good luck! Thomas & Manu

data.formatted_address: 89 Cửa Đại, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hiệu vẽ Hòa Hiệp

reviews.text: Hoa is a really talented artist! Don’t buy your Art at faceless galleries in old town. Come here, meet the Artist himself and get yourself a beautiful souvenir!

data.formatted_address: 240/12 Lý Thường Kiệt, Phường Minh An, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: Hoi An prison relic

reviews.text: We found this by accident while wandering around the city one morning.  Couldn't find it listed under any museums on google maps. Highly recommend going to see this place.  Everything is translated into English as well. Great history presentation of the atrocities placed upon the Vietnamese people during the French and American periods of occupation. Tragic and inspiring at the same time. Go and see this historical landmark.

Powerful and moving it is worth visiting to better understand the struggles the Vietnamese people faced under French and American colonial periods. It seems under visited, but should be a stop for foreign visitors to Hoi An
Highly recommend going to see this place.
